items.name: Adamantine Armor
items.description: This armor converts any critical hit into a normal hit

items.name: Alchemy Jug
items.description: Produces acid, poison, beer, honey, mayo, oil, vinegar, fresh/salt water, wine. 1/day. Up to 2 gal/min

items.name: Amulet of Health
items.description: Your Constitution score becomes 19 while you wear this amulet (it has no effect if your Constitution is already 19 or higher)

items.name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
items.description: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from divination magic; you can’t be targeted by magic scrying sensors or perceived through divination spells

items.name: Amulet of the Planes
items.description: Name a known planar location and make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a success, you cast **Plane Shift** to that destination. On a failure, you travel to a random destination instead

items.name: Animated Shield
items.description: On command (bonus action), the shield animates and hovers, granting you its +2 AC bonus as if wielded while leaving your hands free for 1 minute or until you end it

items.name: Apparatus of Kwalish
items.description: A Large mechanical contraption resembling a brass lobster. AC 20, 200 HP, it can transform to walk or swim and has 10 levers that control its movement and various functions (e.g., extend arms, shine light, open hatch). It’s airtight and can be used to explore underwater

items.name: Armor, +X
items.notes: Any armor; shields have their own entry.

items.name: Armor of Gleaming
items.description: Armor that never gets dirty. No matter the conditions, it remains perpetually clean and shiny

items.name: Armor of Invulnerability
items.description: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to nonmagical damage. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 10 minutes (once per day)

items.name: Armor of Resistance
items.description: Armor that grants resistance to one type of damage (determined when the item is created)

items.name: Armor of Vulnerability
items.description: While wearing this cursed armor, you have resistance to one type of damage (bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing) but vulnerability to the other two types

items.name: Arrow of Slaying
items.description: An arrow designed to slay a particular kind of creature. If it hits such a creature, the target takes an extra 6d10 damage (DC 17 Constitution save for half). Once it deals this extra damage, the arrow loses its magic

items.name: Arrow-Catching Shield
items.description: A shield that gives a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. Additionally, while wielding it, you can use your reaction to redirect an incoming ranged weapon attack to hit you instead of an ally within 5 feet

items.name: Axe of the Dwarvish Lords
items.description: A +3 battleaxe that bears the legacy of dwarven rulers. It functions as multiple other magic items: as a Belt of Dwarvenkind (granting dwarven traits), a Dwarven Thrower (it returns when thrown), and a Sword of Sharpness (severs on critical hits). In addition, dwarves attuned to it gain immunity to poison, Darkvision out to 120 ft, and proficiency with artisan’s tools for brewing, smithing, and stonecutting. It has an evil intellect and a curse, and can summon an Earth Elemental or conjure stone walls

items.name: Bag of Beans
items.description: A bag containing 3d4 magical beans. You can dump the bag’s beans on the ground to cause an explosion (10-foot radius, 5d4 fire damage, Dex DC 15 for half). If you plant a bean in soil and water it, after 1 minute it grows into a large magical effect or creature (determined by rolling on a chaotic results table)

items.name: Bag of Devouring
items.description: This looks like a Bag of Holding but is actually a feeding trap for an extradimensional creature. Organic material put inside has a 50% chance each turn to be destroyed as the bag attempts to devour it. If the bag is used to retrieve an item, there is a chance the creature inside tries to pull the user in (DC 15 Strength save to avoid). Once per day, it can regurgitate its contents into the Astral Plane. Tearing the bag open destroys it and ejects the creature within

items.name: Bag of Holding
items.description: A bag with an interior extradimensional space. It can hold up to 500 pounds (volume up to 64 cubic feet) while always weighing 15 pounds. Items can be retrieved with an action. If the bag is punctured or overloaded, it ruptures (contents spill into the Astral Plane). Turning it inside out empties its contents. Placing this bag inside another extradimensional container instantly destroys both and opens a portal into the Astral Plane

items.name: Bag of Tricks
items.description: A fuzzy cloth bag containing small fuzzy objects. You can reach in and pull out a random fuzzy object (up to 3 per day), which you can then throw. The object transforms into a creature (determined by the color of the bag and a d8 roll) that acts on your turn and obeys your commands. The creature vanishes at dawn or when it drops to 0 HP

items.name: Bead of Force
items.description: This black glass bead can be thrown up to 60 feet. It detonates on impact, releasing a burst of force (10-foot radius, 5d4 force damage, Dex DC 15 for half). Each creature that failed the save is encapsulated in a resilient, immovable force sphere for 1 minute. The sphere can be moved by pushing (weighs 1 lb). Once used, the bead is destroyed

items.name: Bead of Nourishment
items.description: This simple pearl-like bead dissolves upon use and provides as much nourishment as one day’s worth of food (one full ration) to whoever swallows it

items.name: Bead of Refreshment
items.description: This bead dissolves in liquid and transforms up to a pint of liquid into fresh, drinkable water

items.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
items.description: While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits: your Constitution increases by 2 (to a max of 20), you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with dwarves, you have a 50% chance each day to grow a full beard at dawn if you’re capable of growing one (or your existing beard becomes visibly thicker). Additionally, you gain darkvision out to 60 ft, advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage

items.name: Belt of Giant Strength
items.description: A belt infused with the might of giants. While attuned, your Strength score becomes a fixed number based on the kind of giant the belt is associated with. Examples: Hill Giant (Str 21, Rare), Frost/Stone (Str 23, Very Rare), Fire (Str 25, Very Rare), Cloud (Str 27, Legendary), Storm (Str 29, Legendary)

items.name: Berserker Axe
items.description: A +1 greataxe that grants you +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. It is cursed with rage: while attuned, you have advantage on attack rolls with this axe, but whenever combat ends, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or go berserk, attacking the nearest creature (the curse makes it hard to remove once attuned)

items.name: Blackrazor
items.description: A sentient greatsword +3 with a dark personality. It devours the souls of those it kills: when you reduce a creature to 0 HP, Blackrazor slays it and grants you temporary hit points equal to the creature’s total HP. It also grants you haste (as the **Haste** spell) for a short duration after a kill. It can sense life, has an insatiable hunger for souls, and if you go more than a day without it consuming a soul, it may compel you to kill

items.name: Book of Exalted Deeds
items.description: A holy book filled with wisdom of goodness. Only a creature of good alignment can attune to it. Reading and studying the book over a period of time can increase your Wisdom or Charisma, and once all its magic is absorbed, it becomes blank for a century. While attuned, you have the power to create an aura of devotion that hinders fiends and undead, and you cannot be charmed or frightened. It also has other powerful holy properties

items.name: Book of Vile Darkness
items.description: A foul tome of dark secrets. Only a creature of evil alignment can attune to it. Studying its pages can increase your Strength or Intelligence, then the text fades for a time. While attuned, you gain some dark benefits like resistance to certain damage and the ability to summon or command undead or fiends. However, it also corrupts you physically and spiritually. Destroying the book is a quest in itself

items.name: Boots of Elvenkind
items.description: While wearing these soft boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you move across. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently

items.name: Boots of False Tracks
items.description: While wearing these boots, you can choose for them to leave tracks like those of another kind of humanoid of your size, instead of your own tracks

items.name: Boots of Levitation
items.description: While wearing these boots, you can cast **Levitate** on yourself at will (as an action)

items.name: Boots of Speed
items.description: While wearing these boots, you can click your heels together (bonus action) to double your walking speed and grant advantage on Dexterity saving throws for up to 10 minutes per day. During this time, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage. This effect can be used in 1-minute increments (re-activating as long as time remains). If you move at least 10 feet in a round while the effect is active, you must spend 1 minute of its duration

items.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
items.description: While you wear these boots, your walking speed becomes 30 feet, unless it is higher, and your speed isn’t reduced by carrying weight or heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance (though not farther than your remaining movement would allow)

items.name: Boots of the Winterlands
items.description: These furred boots keep you comfortable in frigid environments. While wearing them, you have resistance to cold damage, you ignore difficult terrain created by ice or snow, and you can tolerate temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit without additional protection

items.name: Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals
items.description: If you fill this bowl with water and speak its command, it summons a water elemental as if you had cast the **Conjure Elemental** spell. The elemental is under your control (as per the spell). The bowl can’t be used this way again until the next dawn. Spilling or dumping the water fails to summon anything

items.name: Bracers of Archery
items.description: While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow if you don’t already, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons

items.name: Bracers of Defense
items.description: While wearing these bracers and not wearing armor or using a shield, you gain a +2 bonus to AC

items.name: Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals
items.description: If you speak the brazier’s command word and burn charcoal or wood in it for 1 minute, you summon a fire elemental as if by **Conjure Elemental**. The elemental obeys your commands (as per the spell). The brazier can’t be used this way again until the next dawn

items.name: Brooch of Shielding
items.description: While wearing this brooch, you have resistance to force damage, and you have immunity to damage from the **Magic Missile** spell

items.name: Broom of Flying
items.description: This wooden broom can be ridden to fly. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 200 pounds (but flying speed becomes 30 ft if carrying over 100 pounds). You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination you name within 1 mile as long as you speak the command word and are familiar with the route

items.name: Candle of Invocation
items.description: A blessed candle that aligns with a specific deity or alignment. You can light this candle and it burns for 24 hours (or less if snuffed out). While lit, it creates a 30-foot-radius aura of divine power: if you are within the aura and share the candle’s alignment, you gain advantage on attacks, saves, and ability checks; if of the opposing alignment, you suffer disadvantage. Additionally, you can use the candle to cast **Gate**, targeting the deity or a servant of the aligned faith (which consumes the candle)

items.name: Candle of the Deep
items.description: A magical candle that produces flame even underwater. It can be lit normally, and the flame is not extinguished when immersed in water or in windy conditions (though it still gives off light and heat as normal)

items.name: Cap of Water Breathing
items.description: This old-fashioned cap allows you to breathe normally underwater. While wearing it, you can inhale water as if it were air

items.name: Cape of the Mountebank
items.description: This fine red and gold cape allows you to vanish in a puff of smoke. It has 1 charge. While wearing it, you can use an action to cast **Dimension Door** (the destination is accompanied by a puff of smoke at both departure and arrival). The cape regains its charge at dawn

items.name: Carpet of Flying
items.description: A magic carpet that obeys your commands. It can carry weight and fly at a specified speed based on its size (ranging from 3 ft × 5 ft to 6 ft × 9 ft). You can speak its command word to make it hover and fly. The largest carpet (6 × 9) can carry up to 600 lb at 30 ft speed (or 200 lb at 60 ft). You mentally control the carpet’s movement if you are riding it

items.name: Cast-off Armor
items.description: You can doff this armor quickly. Regardless of its type, you can remove it with only an action

items.name: Censer of Controlling Air Elementals
items.description: If you burn incense in this censer for 1 minute and speak its command word, you summon an air elemental as if by **Conjure Elemental**. The elemental obeys your commands (as per the spell) and disappears after 1 hour or when reduced to 0 HP. The censer can’t be used this way again until the next dawn. (If you are underwater, the summoned elemental is a water elemental instead)

items.name: Charlatan's Die
items.description: This appears to be an ordinary six-sided die, but an attuned user can control its outcome. When you roll this die, you can choose which number it lands on

items.name: Chime of Opening
items.description: A hollow metal tube that can be struck to produce a clear chime. You can use an action to strike it, targeting a locked door, lid, or gate within 120 feet. The chime issues a magical tone that automatically opens the target (as if **Knock** were cast on it). The chime can be used 10 times before it cracks and becomes inert

items.name: Circlet of Blasting
items.description: A crown-like headband that has 1 charge. While wearing it, you can use an action to cast **Scorching Ray** (producing three rays of fire) at +5 attack bonus. The circlet regains its charge at dawn

items.name: Cloak of Arachnida
items.description: A black silk cloak embroidered with spider webs. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits: resistance to poison damage, climbing speed equal to walking speed, the ability to move on walls and ceilings without needing to make an ability check, and the ability to cast **Web** (save DC 13) as an action (recharges at dawn). Additionally, you can’t be caught in webs of any sort and can move through them as if they were difficult terrain

items.name: Cloak of Billowing
items.description: A fashionable cape that you can command (as a bonus action) to billow dramatically behind you, even when there is no wind

items.name: Cloak of Displacement
items.description: This cloak is made from the hide of a displacer beast. While wearing it, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, this property ceases to function until the start of your next turn (it also ceases while you are incapacitated or restrained)

items.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
items.description: While wearing this hooded cloak with its hood up, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and Dexterity (Stealth) checks you make to hide have advantage. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action

items.name: Cloak of Invisibility
items.description: This cloak can be pulled over your body to make you invisible. You can use an action to become invisible while wearing it. The effect lasts for a total of 2 hours, which need not be continuous (each use consumes at least 1 minute of duration). The invisibility ends early if you attack or cast a spell. Reclaiming spent time requires waiting until the next dawn (when the cloak regains 2 hours of invisibility per day)

items.name: Cloak of Many Fashions
items.description: This cloak can magically change its color, style, and overall appearance on command (no action required). It doesn’t change its fundamental shape or size, but it can look like any kind of cloak or cape you desire

items.name: Cloak of Protection
items.description: While wearing this cloak, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws

items.name: Cloak of the Bat
items.description: This dark cloak grants you bat-like abilities. While wearing it in dim light or darkness, you can grip it to fly at a speed of 40 ft. If you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can also use an action to polymorph into a bat (while retaining your Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma). If you lose the cloak or it’s exposed to sunlight, you revert to normal form

items.name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
items.description: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you can breathe underwater, and you have a swimming speed of 60 feet

items.name: Clockwork Amulet
items.description: This copper amulet contains clockwork gears. When you make an attack roll while wearing it, you can forego the roll to instead take a 10 on the d20 (once per dawn). Essentially, you can replace one attack roll with an automatic 10. It resets at dawn

items.name: Clothes of Mending
items.description: This set of ordinary-looking travel clothes magically mends and cleans itself. Any tears, rips, or dirt marks disappear from it daily, ensuring it always looks fresh

items.name: Crystal Ball
items.description: A traditional crystal scrying orb. While attuned, you can cast the **Scrying** spell (Wisdom save DC 17) with it. Some versions of this item (legendary variants) have additional properties, such as allowing **Telepathy** or casting **Detect Thoughts** through the scrying sensor

items.name: Cube of Force
items.description: A small golden cube with inset gemstones. It has 36 charges. You can use an action to press one of its faces to generate an invisible barrier (a 15-foot cube around you) that moves with you. Different faces allow different things to pass through the barrier (for example, one face allows only gases, wind, and ethereal creatures to pass, blocking everything else). Each minute of use or each round certain things hit the barrier expends charges. When charges run out, the cube deactivates. It regains 1d20+6 charges daily at dawn

items.name: Cubic Gate
items.description: A 3-inch cube with each face engraved with a distinct symbol. Each face corresponds to a different plane of existence. You can use an action to press one face to cast **Gate**, opening a portal to the plane indicated. Alternatively, you can use an action to press one face twice to transport yourself and willing nearby creatures to the linked plane. The cube’s portal can remain open or active for a total of 1 minute per day, divided as you choose

items.name: Daern's Instant Fortress
items.description: A small metal cube that can be placed on the ground and activated (action). It rapidly grows into a sturdy 20-foot tall fortress tower (square base 20 ft on a side). The tower has arrow slits, a door that opens only on your command, and battlements. It’s made of adamantine (AC 20, 100 HP per 10-ft section). You can use an action to speak a command word to shrink the fortress back into a cube (provided no creatures are inside). If reduced to 0 HP, the fortress breaks and can’t be used again

items.name: Dagger of Venom
items.description: A magic dagger +1. Once per day, you can use an action to coat the blade in poison. The next creature you hit with it must make a DC 15 Constitution save or take an extra 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute

items.name: Dancing Sword
items.description: You can use a bonus action to toss this magic sword into the air and command it to fight on its own. It hovers and can attack a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you (attack + your modifier). It remains animated for up to 4 rounds, then falls to the ground. This property can be used once per short or long rest

items.name: Dark Shard Amulet
items.description: A bleak crystal amulet used by warlocks. If you are attuned and a warlock, you can try to cast a cantrip that you don’t know. Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check (DC 10); on a success, you cast the chosen warlock cantrip. On a failure, it fizzles and you take psychic feedback (d4 damage per cantrip level). This can be attempted once per long rest

items.name: Decanter of Endless Water
items.description: A stoppered flask that sloshes when shaken, as if filled with water. It has 3 command words: “Stream” (produces 1 gallon of fresh water), “Fountain” (produces 5 gallons), and “Geyser” (produces 30 gallons that gush forth in a 30-foot long, 1-foot wide stream). The geyser can be directed at a target (it can knock them prone and deal a small amount of bludgeoning damage, DC 13 Strength save to resist). Each use is an action, and the decanter can be used as often as desired

items.name: Deck of Illusions
items.description: A deck of 34 illustrated cards. You can use an action to draw a card and throw it to the ground. An illusion of a creature springs up (as determined by the card drawn) as if by **Major Image**. The illusion lasts until dispelled or attacked. Once a card is used, it vanishes. The deck becomes empty when all cards are drawn

items.name: Deck of Many Things
items.description: An infamous set of 13 or 22 tarot-like cards bearing powerful magic. Drawing a card (declared beforehand) causes a supernatural effect—ranging from tremendous fortune (gaining levels or magic items) to disaster (loss of soul, enmity of an outsider, etc.):contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}. Once drawn, a card’s effect occurs and the card fades. The deck is highly unpredictable and campaign-altering

items.name: Defender
items.description: A +3 magic sword (usually a longsword) that allows you to transfer some or all of its bonus to your AC. When you attack with it, you can choose to reduce the attack bonus (up to the +3) and gain an equivalent bonus to your Armor Class until your next turn. Essentially, you can trade offense for defense each swing

items.name: Demon Armor
items.description: Cursed spiked plate armor (AC 18) that grants you a +1 bonus to AC and the ability to make unarmed strikes that deal 1d8+1 slashing damage. However, once donned, you cannot remove this armor unless a **Remove Curse** is cast on you. While wearing it, you have disadvantage on attack rolls against demons, and they have advantage on attack rolls against you

items.name: Dimensional Shackles
items.description: These iron shackles adjust to fit any Small or larger creature. A creature bound by them is restrained and cannot use any method of extradimensional movement (such as teleportation or travel to other planes). They don’t prevent the creature from passing through a **Gate** or similar portal. You can use an action to remove the shackles, and they have 15 hit points (Strength DC 30 to break)

items.name: Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Scale mail made from the scales of a particular kind of dragon. It grants a +1 bonus to AC, advantage on saving throws against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons, and resistance to one damage type corresponding to the dragon (e.g., fire for red dragon scales). Additionally, you can focus your senses to detect the distance and direction to the closest dragon of the same type as the armor within 30 miles (once per day)

items.name: Dragon Slayer
items.description: Any sword (usually a longsword or greatsword) that is especially deadly to dragons. It is a +1 magic weapon. When you hit a dragon with it, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 slashing damage

items.name: Dread Helm
items.description: This fearsome steel helm makes your eyes glow red while you wear it. It’s a cosmetic effect meant to intimidate; it gives you a menacing appearance

items.name: Driftglobe
items.description: A small glass sphere that glows. If you are within 60 feet of it, you can speak a command word to make it float and radiate either the **Light** spell or the **Daylight** spell. Once **Daylight** is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn. If not being carried, the driftglobe hovers 5 feet off the ground and follows you at a distance of up to 60 ft

items.name: Dust of Disappearance
items.description: A pinch of fine dust in a stoppered pouch. You can use an action to throw the dust in the air. You and all creatures and objects within 10 feet become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The effect ends early on a creature that attacks or casts a spell

items.name: Dust of Dryness
items.description: A small packet of gray dust. You can sprinkle a pinch of it into a 15-foot cube of water, converting the water into a marble-sized pellet (the pellet retains the water’s weight). Alternatively, you can throw the pellet at a hard surface to break it and release the water. One pinch can absorb up to 15 cubic feet of water. The packet contains enough dust for multiple uses (typically 1d6+4 pinches total)

items.name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
items.description: Appears to be Dust of Disappearance. If thrown in the air, all creatures that breathe within 30 feet must make a DC 15 Constitution save. On a failure, a creature becomes unable to breathe, begins sneezing uncontrollably, and is incapacitated. While affected, a creature takes 1d4 points of damage at the start of each turn. It can repeat the save at end of turns. On a success, a creature is only incapacitated for a round. This dust is a trap for the unwary user

items.name: Dwarven Plate
items.description: Plate armor (AC 18) made for dwarf lords. It grants a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, while wearing it, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can use your reaction to reduce that distance moved by up to 10 feet

items.name: Dwarven Thrower
items.description: A legendary warhammer +3 (requires attunement by a dwarf ). It gains an extra +1d8 damage when thrown (or +2d8 if the target is a giant) and immediately flies back to your hand after a thrown attack

items.name: Ear Horn of Hearing
items.description: An antique hearing horn that, when used, negates the effects of the deafened condition for the user. Essentially, it allows a deafened creature to hear normally while the horn is used

items.name: Efreeti Bottle
items.description: A stoppered brass bottle etched with images of flame. You can use an action to remove the stopper and command the efreeti inside. There’s a 10% chance the efreeti is hostile and escapes, a 10% chance it grants three wishes (then disappears forever), and an 80% chance it serves you for up to an hour (then returns to the bottle). Once the bottle’s magic is expended (like after the wishes or service), it becomes a nonmagical item

items.name: Efreeti Chain
items.description: Magical chain mail (usually a fiery aesthetic) that provides a +3 bonus to AC. While wearing it, you have immunity to fire damage and can speak the Primordial language (the tongue of elemental creatures)

items.name: Elemental Gem
items.description: A gem of a specific color (blue for water, red for fire, yellow for air, green for earth). You can use an action to crush the gem, which summons an elemental (of the corresponding type) as if you had cast **Conjure Elemental**. The elemental is friendly to you and remains for up to 1 hour or until slain

items.name: Elixir of Health
items.description: A vial of clear red liquid. When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the blinded, deafened, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions

items.name: Elven Chain
items.description: Mithril chain shirt that is so finely crafted, it can be worn even if you lack proficiency in medium armor. It grants a +1 bonus to AC, and you are considered proficient with it even if you normally wouldn’t be

items.name: Enduring Spellbook
items.description: A wizard’s spellbook specially treated to be resistant to damage. It cannot be damaged by fire or water, and it never deteriorates with age

items.name: Ersatz Eye
items.description: A polished artificial eye that can replace a lost eye. While the prosthetic eye is in place and attuned, it functions just like a normal eye (restoring sight if you lost your real eye). The magic of the eye keeps it attached and moving normally

items.name: Eversmoking Bottle
items.description: A sealed brass bottle. When you use an action to remove the stopper, a cloud of thick smoke pours out (heavily obscuring a 60-foot radius area). The smoke leaks out and expands until you use an action to stopper the bottle. The smoke persists and can only be dispersed by strong wind. Stopping the bottle disperses the smoke after 10 minutes

items.name: Eye and Hand of Vecna
items.description: The mummified hand and eye of the arch-lich Vecna. To attune, you must graft the eye into an empty socket and/or replace your hand with the artifact. Once attuned, you gain tremendous necromantic power (spells and special abilities), but at a terrible cost—the artifacts are profoundly evil and begin to corrupt you. The Hand gives strength and destructive touch powers; the Eye grants powerful vision and spell abilities. Both together make you an almost unparalleled wielder of death magic. Removing them costs your life unless special rituals are performed

items.name: Eyes of Charming
items.description: A pair of enchanted glasses or lenses. They have 3 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast **Charm Person** (save DC 13) on a creature you can see. They regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn

items.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
items.description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. When worn, they grant advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight and are made to observe fine details of objects or surfaces within 1 foot

items.name: Eyes of the Eagle
items.description: These ornate goggles sharpen your eyesight. While wearing them, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant objects as though looking through a telescope

items.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power
items.description: These are statuettes of animals carved from various materials. When you speak the command word, the figurine becomes a living creature of its kind, serving you faithfully. Each figurine type has a specific rarity and properties (e.g., a **Bronze Griffon** figurine that can become a griffon for up to 6 hours, usable twice per week). After a certain duration or if it drops to 0 HP, it reverts to figurine form

items.name: Flame Tongue
items.description: A magic sword (often a longsword or rapier) that can erupt in flames. You can use a bonus action to speak its command word, causing flames to engulf the blade. The flames shed bright light (40 ft) and dim light (another 40 ft) and cause the sword to deal an extra 2d6 fire damage on a hit. The flames remain until you extinguish them (no action required)

items.name: Folding Boat
items.description: This object appears to be a small wooden box. It can be commanded to unfold into a boat. The first command word causes it to unfold into a 10-ft long rowboat (4 oars, anchor, etc.). The second command word creates a larger 24-ft long vessel with a mast and sail. A third command word causes it to fold back into a box. Transforming takes 1 round

items.name: Frost Brand
items.description: A magical sword (usually longsword) imbued with cold. It is a +1 weapon that deals an extra 1d6 cold damage on a hit. While you hold it, you have resistance to fire damage. In freezing temperatures, the blade sheds bright light (10 ft) and dim light (another 10 ft). Additionally, when you draw this sword, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you (no action required). This effect can’t be used again until the next dawn

items.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
items.description: While wearing these heavy gauntlets, your Strength score becomes 19, unless it is already 19 or higher

items.name: Gem of Brightness
items.description: A prism that holds 50 charges of light magic. You can use an action to speak a command word and expend charges to produce one of three effects: **(1)** Make the gem shed bright light in a 30-ft radius (and dim light 30 ft beyond) for 10 minutes (no charge); **(2)** Illuminate a brilliant beam at one creature (within 60 ft) forcing a DC 15 Constitution save or be blinded for 1 minute (expends 1 charge); **(3)** Create a blinding flare in a 30-ft cone (expends 5 charges) forcing the same save or blind multiple targets. The gem regains 1d4+1 charges at dawn

items.name: Gem of Seeing
items.description: A sapphire lens or gem that has 3 charges. While holding it to your eye, you can expend 1 charge to gain **Truesight** out to 120 feet for 10 minutes. The gem regains 1d3 expended charges each day at dawn

items.name: Giant Slayer
items.description: A magic weapon (usually a sword or axe) +1. When you hit a giant (any creature with the Giant type) with it, the giant takes an extra 2d6 damage. Also, the giant must succeed on a DC 15 Strength save or fall prone

items.name: Glamoured Studded Leather
items.description: Studded leather armor +1 that can magically change its appearance. You can use a bonus action to cause the armor to look like normal clothing or some other kind of armor. Regardless of appearance, it retains its protective properties

items.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
items.description: While wearing these gloves, when a ranged weapon attack hits you, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier. If you reduce the damage to 0, you catch the projectile (if it’s small enough to hold in one hand and you have a hand free)

items.name: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
items.description: While wearing these webbed, friction-textured gloves, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal movement speed, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim or climb

items.name: Gloves of Thievery
items.description: These gloves are invisible when worn. While wearing them, you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Dexterity checks made to pick locks

items.name: Goggles of Night
items.description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet

items.name: Hammer of Thunderbolts
items.description: A magic warhammer +1 that can be attuned only by someone with Gauntlets of Ogre Power and a Belt of Giant Strength. When attuned under those conditions, it becomes a +3 weapon. It deals an extra 2d6 thunder damage on a hit. If thrown (range 20/60), it emits a thunderclap audible out to 300 feet and the target (if a creature) must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution save or be stunned until the end of your next turn. It returns to your hand when thrown

items.name: Hat of Disguise
items.description: This hat allows you to cast **Disguise Self** at will (no components required)

items.name: Hat of Vermin
items.description: This old cloth hat has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and pull out a harmless furry creature (a bat, a frog, or a rat – determined at random). The summoned creature is not under your control, but it is ordinary and nonhostile. It vanishes at the next dawn or when it drops to 0 HP. The hat regains all charges at dawn

items.name: Hat of Wizardry
items.description: A pointy wizard’s hat stitched with stars and moons. If you are a wizard wearing it, you can try to cast a wizard cantrip that you don’t know. You must make a DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a success, you cast the cantrip; on a failure, the cantrip fails (but the use of this property isn’t expended). This can be attempted once per long rest

items.name: Headband of Intellect
items.description: While wearing this headband, your Intelligence score becomes 19, unless it is already 19 or higher

items.name: Helm of Brilliance
items.description: A helm decorated with 10 diamonds, 20 rubies, 30 fire opals, and 40 opals. It has many magical properties: it glows in the presence of undead or fiends; you have resistance to fire damage; you can use an action to expend some of the embedded gems to produce spell effects (gems are consumed): diamonds cast **Prismatic Spray**, rubies cast **Wall of Fire**, fire opals cast **Fireball**, opals cast **Daylight**. If you take significant fire damage while wearing it, some gems may detonate. The helm loses magic when all gems are gone

items.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
items.description: While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast **Comprehend Languages** at will (on yourself only)

items.name: Helm of Telepathy
items.description: While wearing this brass helm, you can use an action to cast **Detect Thoughts** (save DC 13). As long as you maintain concentration on Detect Thoughts, you can use a bonus action to cast **Suggestion** (DC 13) on a creature you are reading (the target automatically fails its save against Suggestion if the Detect Thoughts spell is still active and you’ve probed its mind). These properties reset at dawn

items.name: Helm of Teleportation
items.description: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast **Teleport** (transporting yourself and willing creatures as the spell). The helm regains 1d3 charges each day at dawn

items.name: Heward's Handy Haversack
items.description: A small backpack with multiple extradimensional pockets. Each of the two side pouches can hold up to 20 pounds of items (space of 2 cubic feet each) and the main pouch can hold up to 80 pounds (8 cubic feet). The haversack always weighs only 5 pounds. When you reach into it for a specific item, that item is always magically on top. If the haversack is overloaded or punctured, it ruptures and is destroyed, scattering its contents in the Astral Plane

items.name: Heward's Handy Spice Pouch
items.description: A magical spice pouch with 10 charges. As an action, you can spend 1 charge to pull out a pinch of a nonmagical seasoning (salt, pepper, garlic, etc.) of your choice. The pouch regains 1d6+4 charges each dawn

items.name: Holy Avenger
items.description: A revered +3 sword (typically a greatsword or longsword) that requires attunement by a Paladin. When you hit a fiend or undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage. Additionally, while you hold the sword, you and all allies within 10 ft have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. If you are attuned and have at least one spell slot, the radius of this aura increases to 30 ft

items.name: Horn of Blasting
items.description: You can use an action to blow this horn, creating a 30-foot cone of deafening sound. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution save or take 5d6 thunder damage and be deafened for 1 minute (half damage and not deafened on a success). Creatures made of inorganic material (stone, crystal, metal) have disadvantage on the save. Each use of the horn has a 20% chance of causing it to explode (dealing 10d6 fire damage to the blower)

items.name: Horn of Silent Alarm
items.description: This brass horn has 4 charges. You can use an action to spend 1 charge and blow the horn. Only one creature of your choice (who you can see, within 600 feet) hears the horn’s blare—no other creature hears the sound. The horn regains 1d4 charges daily at dawn

items.name: Horn of Valhalla
items.description: A silver or brass war horn (rarity varies by material). You can use an action to blow the horn. A number of warrior spirits (berserkers) appear to aid you, based on the horn’s type: e.g., the Silver horn summons 2d4+2 berserkers. Once you use the horn, it can’t be used again for 7 days. Only a character of proficient with all martial weapons can use the horn properly (others who attempt to use it might take psychic damage)

items.name: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
items.description: These four iron horseshoes attach themselves to the hooves of a horse or similar mount. While attached, the mount can move normally while floating 4 inches above the ground. This effect means the mount ignores difficult terrain, can walk on water or fragile surfaces without falling, and leaves no tracks

items.name: Horseshoes of Speed
items.description: These four magical horseshoes clamp onto a horse or similar creature’s hooves. The creature’s walking speed increases by 30 feet

items.name: Immovable Rod
items.description: A flat iron rod with a button. When you press the button (action), the rod fixes itself in space. It does not move, even defying gravity. It can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. A DC 30 Strength check is needed to move it one inch. Pressing the button again releases it

items.name: Instrument of Illusions
items.description: A musical instrument (such as a lute or flute) that creates minor illusions. While attuned and playing this instrument, you can create harmless, illusory visual effects that fit with the music (e.g., dancing lights, spectral dancers). The illusions have no sound and last only while you play

items.name: Instrument of Scribing
items.description: A magical pen or other writing instrument with 3 charges. While attuned, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cause the instrument to write a magical message of up to 25 words on a surface. The message remains for 24 hours, then fades. The instrument regains all charges daily

items.name: Instrument of the Bards
items.description: A family of magical musical instruments (like the Fochlucan Bandore, Canaith Mandolin, etc.), each named and of ascending rarity. All require attunement by a Bard. Each instrument grants the ability to cast a set of spells (e.g., **Fly**, **Invisibility**, **Levitate**, **Protection from Evil and Good**, etc. depending on the instrument) a limited number of times per day. It also grants advantage on musical performance checks. Each specific instrument has its own list of spells and properties

items.name: Ioun Stone
items.description: These are magical stones (of varying colors and shapes) that float and orbit around your head once attuned. Each stone grants a different benefit while orbiting you. Examples: Ioun Stone of Leadership (clear spindle) increases one ability score to 19; Ioun Stone of Regeneration (violet) lets you regain HP gradually; etc. Each stone is a rare to very rare item depending on its benefit

items.name: Iron Bands of Bilarro
items.description: A rusty iron sphere that can be thrown at a creature. When it hits, it bursts into iron bands that wrap the target. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be restrained. While restrained, the creature can take an action to attempt a DC 20 Strength check to break free (destroying the bands on a success). Otherwise, the bands can be attacked (AC 20, 20 HP, immune to all but bludgeoning damage). Once used (successfully restraining), the bands can only be reset by speaking a command word (and only if the creature is no longer restrained by them)

items.name: Iron Flask
items.description: A metal flask sealed with a brass stopper and arcane sigils. The flask can trap creatures. As an action, you can speak a command word targeting a creature you can see within 60 ft. The creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom save or be trapped in the flask (if it’s native to a different plane of existence than the one you’re on). Only one creature can be trapped at a time. You can release the creature by removing the stopper (it is under no obligation to serve you). The flask can only imprison a creature once before losing its magic

items.name: Javelin of Lightning
items.description: A magic javelin that can transform into a bolt of lightning. When you hurl it and speak its command word, it turns into a 5-ft wide, 120-ft long line of lightning. Each creature in the line (except you and the target) must make a DC 13 Dexterity save, taking 4d6 lightning damage on a failure (half on success). The lightning bolt turns back into a javelin when it reaches the target, then you make a normal attack against the target (which takes damage from the javelin plus 4d6 lightning). This property can be used once per dawn

items.name: Keoghtom's Ointment
items.description: A small jar containing 1d4+1 doses of a thick mixture. One dose, applied to the skin or swallowed, cures you of any disease, removes the poisoned condition, and heals 2d8+2 hit points

items.name: Lantern of Revealing
items.description: A hooded lantern that burns oil normally. While lit, it illuminates invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible. Any invisible creature in the bright light of the lantern becomes visible

items.name: Lock of Trickery
items.description: A padlock that imposes mischief on those trying to pick it. The DC to pick this lock with thieves’ tools is 15. If the attempt fails by 5 or more, the lock emits a loud *laughing* noise. Regardless, any attempt to pick the lock is made at disadvantage due to its tricky mechanisms

items.name: Luck Blade
items.description: A +1 sword (often a shortsword) that has 1d4-1 charges of **Wish** stored in it. It regains 1 expended Wish charge each year. Also, while attuned, you have **Luck**: if you make an attack roll, ability check, or save, you can reroll it and choose which result to use (this property resets at dawn). After using **Wish** via the blade, that charge is gone until it regains one naturally

items.name: Mace of Disruption
items.description: A holy mace +1. When you hit a fiend or undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target has 25 HP or fewer after taking this damage, it must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or be instantly destroyed (if undead or a fiend) or frightened of you (if it has more HP). The mace also glows with bright light (20 ft) whenever an undead or fiend is within 120 feet of you

items.name: Mace of Smiting
items.description: A magic mace +1. It becomes +3 when used to attack constructs. On a critical hit against a construct, the hit deals an extra 7 bludgeoning damage (or 14 extra if the weapon is +3 against that target), and there is a 50% chance the construct is instantly destroyed if it has 25 HP or fewer

items.name: Mace of Terror
items.description: This magic mace has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to release a wave of terror. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or be frightened of you for 1 minute. Frightened targets can repeat the save at end of turns to end the effect. The mace regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn

items.name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
items.description: A protective cloak that shimmers with arcane energy. While wearing this mantle, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects

items.name: Manual of Bodily Health
items.description: One of a set of magical tomes. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying this book, your Constitution score increases by 2, and your maximum for that score increases by 2. The manual then loses its magic, and regains it in a century

items.name: Manual of Gainful Exercise
items.description: Another magical tome. Studying it for 48 hours over no more than 6 days increases your Strength score by 2, and your maximum for Strength increases by 2. The manual becomes nonmagical afterward until a hundred years pass

items.name: Manual of Golems
items.description: A thick tome detailing the creation of a golem. The manual specifies a particular type of golem (clay, flesh, iron, or stone). To use it, you must spend the specified time and gold to construct the golem’s body and cast spells as the manual instructs. If you succeed, the manual is consumed and a golem comes to life under your control. If you fail or cease construction, the manual isn’t consumed (but any gold spent is wasted). Each manual can be used only once

items.name: Manual of Quickness of Action
items.description: Another tome of understanding. Studying it for 48 hours over ≤6 days increases your Dexterity score by 2 (and your Dex maximum by 2). The manual then loses its magic for 100 years

items.name: Mariner's Armor
items.description: A set of armor (any type) that is specially treated for the sea. While wearing it, you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and if you sink below 0 HP while in water, the armor automatically carries you to the surface

items.name: Medallion of Thoughts
items.description: This amulet has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast **Detect Thoughts** (save DC 13). It regains 1d3 charges daily

items.name: Mirror of Life Trapping
items.description: A 4-ft tall mirror with an ornate frame. It contains 12 extra-dimensional cells. You can use an action to speak a command word and activate the mirror for 1 minute. During that time, any time a creature sees its reflection in the mirror (within 30 ft), it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma save or be trapped in one of the mirror’s cells. The mirror can hold up to 12 creatures. Another command word can free a specific trapped creature. Breaking the mirror frees all. Each prisoner doesn’t age and doesn’t need to eat or drink while trapped

items.name: Mithral Armor
items.description: Any Medium or Heavy armor (except hide) crafted from mithral, a light and flexible metal. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Stealth or has a Strength requirement, a mithral version does not. For instance, mithral plate has no Str requirement and doesn’t impose Stealth disadvantage

items.name: Moon-touched Sword
items.description: A sword that glows under moonlight. It’s a common magic sword with no bonus, but when drawn, it sheds bright moonlight in a 15-foot radius and dim light for another 15 feet

items.name: Moonblade
items.description: An ancient elven magical longsword, unique in each incarnation. It starts as a +1 longsword but can gain additional powers and +1 bonuses for each “rune” it awakens (linked to each attunement by an elf in its history). Typically, a fully awakened moonblade might be +3 and have several special properties (like detecting evil, shooting beams of light, etc.). It is sentient and only allows attunement by elves or those it deems worthy. It also protects elvenkind (for example, some moonblades grant a defensive aura to elf allies)

items.name: Mystery Key
items.description: An old key of unknown origin. It has a 5% chance of unlocking any lock (one use). When it successfully opens a lock, or when it fails to open anything, the key disappears in a puff of smoke

items.name: Necklace of Adaptation
items.description: While wearing this necklace, you can breathe normally in any environment (including toxic gas or underwater), and you have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases and vapors (such as cloudkill or inhaled poisons)

items.name: Necklace of Fireballs
items.description: A necklace strung with golden beads. It has 1d6+3 beads. You can use an action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet. It detonates as a 3rd-level **Fireball** spell (save DC 15). You can hurl multiple beads at once to increase the spell’s level for each additional bead. Once all beads are used, the necklace becomes nonmagical

items.name: Necklace of Prayer Beads
items.description: A necklace with 1d4+2 magical beads, each corresponding to a spell. Six types of beads exist (Bless, Curing, Favor, Smiting, Summons, Wind Walking). If you’re a spellcaster, you can use an action to touch a bead and cast its spell (spell save DC 15) without expending a spell slot. Once used, a bead’s magic is lost until the next dawn (for beads of Bless, Curing, or Wind Walking) or permanently for others

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer
items.description: A +2 magic sword (usually a longsword) with a dark enchantment. It has 1d8+1 charges. When you score a critical hit against a creature with fewer than 100 HP, it must make a DC 15 Constitution save. On a failure, it is instantly slain as the sword steals its life (expending one charge). The sword loses its magic when all charges are spent

items.name: Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments
items.description: A set of vibrant paints. You can use them to paint an object or terrain feature (up to 100 square feet). After 10 minutes, the painting becomes a real, nonmagical object of that form. For example, you can paint a door on a wall, and it becomes a real door. You can’t create magic items, and living creatures created are only realistic illusions. There is a limited amount of paint, enough to cover 1,000 square feet in total

items.name: Oathbow
items.description: An elegant white longbow. When you nock an arrow and whisper “Swift defeat to my enemies” in Elvish, you designate a creature as this bow’s *sworn enemy*. Against that target, you have advantage on attack rolls, and you deal an extra 3d6 piercing damage on a hit. You cannot use this property on another target until your current sworn enemy dies or 7 days pass. While your sworn enemy lives, you have disadvantage with all other weapons

items.name: Oil of Etherealness
items.description: A thick silvery oil. You can apply it to yourself over 10 minutes. After application, you gain the effect of the **Etherealness** spell (for up to 1 hour). This allows you to move through objects and access the Ethereal Plane temporarily

items.name: Oil of Sharpness
items.description: A glittering oil that can coat a bladed weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying it takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon or ammo becomes magical and gets a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls

items.name: Oil of Slipperiness
items.description: A thick, clear oil. You can apply it to yourself (or pour it on the ground). If applied to a creature, it gains the effect of the **Freedom of Movement** spell for 8 hours (no restraint, no reduction of speed). If poured on a surface, it replicates the effect of a **Grease** spell (10-foot square of slippery ground) for 8 hours

items.name: Orb of Direction
items.description: While holding this small glass orb, you can use an action to determine which way is north. The orb gently rotates or illuminates to indicate the direction of true north, no matter your location (even if underground or on another plane)

items.name: Orb of Dragonkind
items.description: One of a set of legendary crystal orbs created by dragons. Each orb is linked to a dragon type (chromatic). The orb allows the attuned wielder to communicate with and control dragons of the associated type (contested Charisma checks). It also has a suite of powerful spells (e.g., **Bless**, **Cure Wounds**, **Daylight**, **Scrying**, **Teleport**, etc.) and radiates an aura that can frighten dragons. However, each orb houses the essence of an evil dragon and may try to dominate or corrupt the user. The orbs are extremely powerful and dangerous artifacts

items.name: Orb of Time
items.description: A small crystalline orb that, when held, gives you a sense of the current time of day. By peering into the orb, you can tell whether it is morning, afternoon, evening, or night outside (regardless of your location). It’s often used by dwellers underground to keep time

items.name: Pearl of Power
items.description: While attuned to this pearl and holding it, you can use an action to regain one expended spell slot (up to 3rd level). Once you use the pearl, it can’t be used again until the next dawn

items.name: Perfume of Bewitching
items.description: A vial of sweet perfume. You can use an action to apply it to yourself, and for the next hour you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at humanoids of Challenge Rating 1 or lower. Creatures of CR 1 or lower will generally view you favorably (as if charmed) for that duration, unless you or your allies attack them

items.name: Periapt of Health
items.description: A pendant that protects against sickness. While wearing it, you are immune to contracting any disease. If you are already infected with a disease, the symptoms are suspended while you wear the periapt

items.name: Periapt of Proof against Poison
items.description: An amulet dangling a clear gemstone. While worn, it grants immunity to poison: you are immune to the poisoned condition and to poison damage

items.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
items.description: A crystal amulet on a chain. While attuned and wearing it, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, you double the number of HP restored. In addition, if you have this periapt on your person, whenever you start your turn at 0 HP, you automatically stabilize

items.name: Philter of Love
items.description: A rose-hued effervescent potion. The next time you see a creature within 10 minutes of drinking it, you become charmed by that creature for 1 hour (as if affected by a **Charm Person** spell). If the creature is of a gender and species you’d normally be attracted to, you regard it as your true love while charmed

items.name: Pipe of Smoke Monsters
items.description: A whimsical wooden pipe. If you smoke it, you can use an action to exhale a puff of smoke that takes the form of a single creature (like a dragon, horse, etc.) for a few seconds before dissipating. The form is non-substantial and disappears quickly

items.name: Pipes of Haunting
items.description: A set of panpipes with frightful carvings. It has 3 charges. If you are proficient with wind instruments, you can use an action to play them and expend 1 charge to create an eerie tune. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet that hear it must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or be frightened of you for 1 minute. A target that saves is immune to these pipes for 24 hours. The pipes regain 1d3 charges each dawn

items.name: Pipes of the Sewers
items.description: These wooden pipes have 3 charges. If you are proficient with wind instruments, you can use an action to play a shrill tune and expend 1 to 3 charges. For each charge expended, you summon a swarm of rats (50% chance for a giant rat instead) that emerge 1 round later. The swarms obey your musical commands. After 1 hour, they disappear or when you stop playing. The pipes regain 1d3 charges daily. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20; on a 1, the pipes lose their magic

items.name: Plate Armor of Etherealness
items.description: Plate armor (AC 18) that allows the wearer to phase into the Ethereal Plane. You can use an action to cast **Etherealness** (no components required). The effect lasts up to 10 minutes or until you remove the armor. This property can’t be used again until the next dawn

items.name: Pole of Angling
items.description: A 10-foot pole that can, on command, transform into a fishing pole with a hook, line, and reel. It’s a mundane but useful tool for catching fish—it doesn’t guarantee success, but provides a proper fishing apparatus

items.name: Pole of Collapsing
items.description: A 10-foot pole that can collapse into a 1-foot rod. You can speak a command word to cause the pole to telescope out to 10 feet or collapse back to 1 foot. This doesn’t alter its weight (which is 2 pounds). It can be used as a ladder, pole, etc., and easily stowed when collapsed

items.name: Portable Hole
items.description: A circular cloth, 6 feet in diameter, that can be unfolded onto a surface to create an extradimensional hole 10 feet deep. The interior is a space 10 ft across. You can climb in and out (rope recommended). Folding the cloth causes everything inside the hole to spill out. The cloth can be picked up (closing the hole). If placed inside an extradimensional container (like a Bag of Holding), it tears a rift to the Astral Plane, destroying both items

items.name: Pot of Awakening
items.description: A terra-cotta flower pot. If you plant a normal shrub in this pot and let it grow for 30 days, the shrub magically becomes an awakened shrub (gains sentience and limited mobility) at the end of that time. The awakened shrub is friendly to you. Only one shrub can be awakened at a time from the pot

items.name: Potion of Animal Friendship
items.description: When you drink this potion, you can cast **Animal Friendship** (save DC 13) for 1 hour at will. The potion’s effect ends after one hour, and the liquid is consumed on first use

items.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
items.description: Drinking this clear potion grants you the effect of the **Clairvoyance** spell. For the next hour, you can create an invisible sensor within 1 mile and see or hear through it (as per the spell). Once the effect ends, it does not recur

items.name: Potion of Climbing
items.description: For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You also gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to climb during that duration

items.name: Potion of Diminution
items.description: For 1d4 hours after drinking it, you gain the “reduce” effect of the **Enlarge/Reduce** spell: your size shrinks to one category smaller (to a minimum of Tiny), and your weight is reduced accordingly. You have disadvantage on Strength checks and saves, and your weapons deal less damage (per the spell)

items.name: Potion of Fire Breath
items.description: After drinking this potion, you can use a bonus action to exhale fire at a target within 30 feet. The target must make a DC 13 Dexterity save or take 4d6 fire damage (half on success). This effect can be used up to 3 times, or it ends 1 hour after you drink the potion (whichever comes first)

items.name: Potion of Flying
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour and can hover. If the effect ends while you’re aloft and nothing else is holding you aloft, you fall

items.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
items.description: Drinking this potion transforms you as if by the **Gaseous Form** spell for 1 hour (no concentration required). You and your gear become a misty cloud; you gain a flying speed of 10 ft, resistance to nonmagical damage, and can pass through small holes. The effect ends early if you dismiss it (bonus action) or if you drop to 0 HP

items.name: Potion of Giant Strength
items.description: A potion that boosts Strength. The specific Strength score and potion rarity depends on the giant whose strength it mimics: Hill Giant (Str 21, Uncommon), Frost/Stone (Str 23, Rare), Fire (Str 25, Rare), Cloud (Str 27, Very Rare), Storm (Str 29, Legendary). The effect lasts for 1 hour

items.name: Potion of Growth
items.description: For 1d4 hours after drinking it, you gain the “enlarge” effect of the **Enlarge/Reduce** spell: your size doubles in all dimensions (to a max of Large), your weight increases by eight times, and you have advantage on Strength checks and saves. Your weapons also grow and deal an extra 1d4 damage. After the duration, you return to normal size

items.name: Potion of Healing
items.description: A magical red fluid that restores hit points when drunk. **Common:** Regain 2d4+2 HP (Healing Potion); **Uncommon (Greater):** 4d4+4 HP; **Rare (Superior):** 8d4+8 HP; **Very Rare (Supreme):** 10d4+20 HP. The potion’s potency depends on its rarity

items.name: Potion of Heroism
items.description: For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points, and you are under the effect of the **Bless** spell (no concentration required, you add a d4 to attack rolls and saving throws for the duration)

items.name: Potion of Invisibility
items.description: After drinking this potion, you become invisible for 1 hour, as if under the **Invisibility** spell. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell

items.name: Potion of Invulnerability
items.description: For 1 minute after drinking it, you have resistance to all damage

items.name: Potion of Longevity
items.description: This rare potion’s magic can extend your lifespan. When you drink it, your physical age is reduced by 1d6 + 6 years (to a minimum age of 13). Every time you consume another potion of longevity, there is a cumulative 10% chance that instead your age increases by that amount. You can only benefit from this reduction a limited number of times before fate catches up

items.name: Potion of Mind Reading
items.description: For 1 hour after drinking it, you are able to read the thoughts of others as if by the **Detect Thoughts** spell (Wisdom save DC 13 to resist deeper probing)

items.name: Potion of Poison
items.description: This potion is actually a dangerous brew. It tastes and looks like a healing potion, but it is poison. If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage and must make a DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage at the start of each of your turns until cured. Because of its similarity to healing potions, it often fools the unwary

items.name: Potion of Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to one type of damage for 1 hour. The type is determined by the potion’s key ingredient (e.g., dragon scale for a certain element). Common examples include resistance to acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder damage

items.name: Potion of Speed
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the **Haste** spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). For the duration, your speed is doubled, you gain +2 AC, advantage on Dexterity saves, and an extra action each turn (limited to attack [one weapon attack], dash, disengage, hide, or use object). After 1 minute, you suffer the normal lethargy when the effect ends (no actions for 1 round)

items.name: Potion of Vitality
items.description: When you drink this syrupy potion, it removes any exhaustion you are suffering, and cures any disease or poison affecting you. For the next 24 hours, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, treat the die as if it rolled its maximum value

items.name: Potion of Water Breathing
items.description: After drinking this potion, you can breathe underwater for 1 hour. This potion is often carried by adventurers exploring aquatic environments

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token
items.description: A magic feather with one of several enchantments (determined randomly or by choice). Examples: **Anchor** (feather becomes an immovable anchor), **Bird** (giant bird appears to serve as mount for a day), **Fan** (creates gust of wind), **Swan Boat** (forms a boat), etc. Each token can be used once to create a specific effect then becomes nonmagical

items.name: Quiver of Ehlonna
items.description: Also known as a Efficient Quiver, this quiver has multiple compartments that hold far more ammunition and gear than a normal quiver. Each compartment can hold a certain amount: e.g., the longest compartment can hold up to 6 long objects like bows or quarterstaffs, the mid-size up to 18 javelins or similar, and the shortest up to 60 arrows or bolts. The quiver always weighs 2 lbs. You can draw any stored item as if from a regular quiver or scabbard

items.name: Ring of Animal Influence
items.description: This ring has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can expend an action and some charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 13): **Animal Friendship** (1 charge), **Fear** targeting only beasts (2 charges), or **Speak with Animals** (1 charge). The ring regains 1d3 charges at dawn

items.name: Ring of Djinni Summoning
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can speak its command word to summon a specific djinni from the Elemental Plane of Air. The djinni appears for up to 1 hour and is friendly to you (acting on your initiative count). It serves you and obeys your commands, even fighting on your behalf. It can be summoned once per day. Misusing the djinni or rolling a natural 1 on an attack roll while it’s summoned might free it from service (at the DM’s discretion)

items.name: Ring of Elemental Command
items.description: There are four variants of this ring (Air, Earth, Fire, Water). Each grants various powers related to its element once certain conditions are met (like defeating an elemental of that type to awaken the ring’s full power). For example, the Ring of Fire Elemental Command might grant resistance to fire, the ability to speak Ignan, and spells like **Burning Hands**, **Fireball**, **Wall of Fire**, etc., along with the ability to **Dominate** a fire elemental. Each ring is extremely powerful when fully activated

items.name: Ring of Evasion
items.description: This ring has 3 charges. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw while wearing it, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge to succeed on that saving throw instead. The ring regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn

items.name: Ring of Feather Falling
items.description: While wearing this ring, you descend slowly. You automatically fall at a rate of 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling, no matter the distance (as if under a continuous **Feather Fall** effect)

items.name: Ring of Free Action
items.description: While attuned and wearing this ring, you are unaffected by difficult terrain, and magic cannot reduce your speed or cause you to be paralyzed or restrained. If you are already restrained by nonmagical means, you can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape

items.name: Ring of Invisibility
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can turn invisible as an action. The invisibility doesn’t end when you attack or cast a spell – it lasts until you remove the ring or until the ring is deactivated. However, the ring’s magic craves secrecy; if someone sees you while you’re invisible (due to Truesight, for example), the ring’s invisibility may falter temporarily

items.name: Ring of Jumping
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can cast the **Jump** spell on yourself at will (as a bonus action)

items.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
items.description: While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, discern if you’re lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. You can also choose to be undetectable to telepathy. Additionally, if you die while wearing the ring, your soul can choose to pass into the ring instead of moving on, where it can remain and communicate telepathically. The ring then keeps your soul unless someone else tries to attune to it

items.name: Ring of Poison Resistance
items.description: While wearing this ring, you have resistance to poison damage. (This ring is one of many **Ring of Resistance** variants, each granting resistance to a specific damage type)

items.name: Ring of Protection
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and to all saving throws while wearing this ring

items.name: Ring of Regeneration
items.description: While wearing this ring, you regain 1d6 hit points every 10 minutes, provided you have at least 1 HP. Additionally, if you lose a body part, the ring causes it to regrow after 1d6 + 1 days as long as you wear the ring that whole time

items.name: Ring of Resistance
items.description: One of several rings that grant resistance to a particular damage type. When you attune, the ring’s type becomes fixed. For example, a Ring of Cold Resistance grants you resistance to cold damage while worn. Other variants exist for fire, lightning, necrotic, etc.

items.name: Ring of Shooting Stars
items.description: This ring can only be used outdoors at night. It has 6 charges. You can expend charges to create magical effects: for example, with 1 charge you can create **Dancing Lights** or a ball of light that hovers and explodes (like a **Fireball** but only 4d12 damage, Dex DC 15); with 2 charges you can cast **Faerie Fire**; with 3 charges you can call down a 120-ft long, 5-ft wide lightning bolt for 4d6 lightning (Dex DC 15 half). The ring regains 1d6 charges daily at dusk

items.name: Ring of Spell Storing
items.description: This ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells (at most, five level-1 spells, or one level-5 spell, etc.). Any creature can cast a spell into the ring by touching it (the spell has no effect but is stored). The ring can hold the spell indefinitely. The attuned wearer can cast any spell stored in the ring, using the spell’s normal parameters, and once cast from the ring, that spell is expended from storage. The ring initially is empty when found

items.name: Ring of Spell Turning
items.description: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only you (not in an area). Additionally, if you succeed on such a save and the spell is 7th level or lower, it has no effect on you and is reflected back at the caster as if it were the spell’s target

items.name: Ring of Swimming
items.description: While wearing this ring, you have a swimming speed of 40 feet

items.name: Ring of Telekinesis
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can cast **Telekinesis** at will, but only targeting objects that aren’t being worn or carried (no concentration required for these objects). Additionally, you can attempt to manipulate creatures with Telekinesis as normal by concentrating (save DC 18)

items.name: Ring of the Ram
items.description: This ring has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 to 3 charges to attack one creature within 60 feet with a spectral ram’s head. It’s a ranged spell attack with +7 bonus. On a hit, for each charge spent, the target takes 2d10 force damage. Alternatively, you can expend 1 to 3 charges to try to break an object or push a creature (if creature, it makes a DC 17 Strength save or is pushed 5 feet per charge spent). The ring regains 1d3 charges each dawn

items.name: Ring of Three Wishes
items.description: This ring has 3 charges and holds the **Wish** spell. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast **Wish**. Once all charges are used, the ring becomes nonmagical. Because **Wish** is so powerful, many consider this ring one of the most coveted but dangerous items in existence

items.name: Ring of Warmth
items.description: While wearing this ring, you have resistance to cold damage. Also, you and everything you wear or carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit

items.name: Ring of Water Walking
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground

items.name: Ring of X-ray Vision
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can use an action to see into and through solid matter (as if by **X-ray**). This special sight lasts for 1 minute. During that time, you can see through up to 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood/dirt. Thicker substances or a thin sheet of lead block this vision. It can be used again after 1 minute on, 1 minute off (alternating usage). After three total minutes of use in a day, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save when activating it or gain one level of exhaustion

items.name: Robe of Eyes
items.description: A robe covered in dozens of ritualistic eye patterns. While wearing it, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, you have darkvision out to 120 ft, and you can see invisible creatures and objects as well as into the Ethereal Plane (out to 120 ft). However, you have disadvantage on sight-based saves against bright light (like a Medusa’s glare or **Sunburst** spell) and are vulnerable to flash/blinding effects. If you are targeted by a spell like **Antimagic Field** or your robe goes through an **Antimagic** effect, all the eyes on it close (negating its benefits) until you’re out of the area

items.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
items.description: A robe with color-changing patches. It has 3 charges. You can use an action to expend 1 charge, causing the robe’s colors to shimmer and glow for 1 minute. During this time, the robe sheds bright light (30 ft) and dim light (another 30 ft). Any creature that starts its turn within 30 ft and can see you must make a DC 15 Wisdom save or be stunned until the start of its next turn. Additionally, attacks against you have disadvantage. The robe regains 1d3 charges daily

items.name: Robe of Stars
items.description: A black or dark blue robe speckled with star-like motes. It has 6 stars (represented by cloth patches). While wearing the robe, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws. You can also use an action to pull off one of the stars, causing it to become a **Magic Missile** spell (cast at 5th level). Once all stars are used, the robe still offers its save bonus. Additionally, while wearing it, you can use an action to enter the Astral Plane (along with any worn/carried items). You remain there until you use another action to return. This property can’t be used again until the next dawn

items.name: Robe of the Archmagi
items.description: A regal robe that can be attuned by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard of a specific alignment (each robe is made for neutral, good, or evil). It grants AC 15 + Dex mod while you are not wearing armor, and you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, your spell save DC and spell attack rolls gain a +2 bonus. Only the intended alignment wearer can attune; others take heavy damage if they try

items.name: Robe of Useful Items
items.description: A robe with many cloth patches of various shapes. It initially has 4d4 patches, each with a simple illustration. You can use an action to detach a patch, causing it to become the object depicted. Standard patches include things like: a 10-foot pole, a ladder, a riding horse, a pit, bags of gold, potions of healing, etc. Once a patch is removed, it can’t be used again. When all patches are gone, the robe is just an ordinary garment

items.name: Rod of Absorption
items.description: This rod can absorb magical energy directed at its holder. While attuned and holding it, whenever you are targeted by a spell, the rod can absorb the spell (along with its effects) if it has charges available. It can absorb up to 50 levels of spells over its lifetime. Once it absorbs a spell, you can use the stored levels to cast spells you have prepared (without expending your own slots). The rod cannot absorb spells that don’t target only you or that exceed its remaining capacity. Once it absorbs 50 levels, it can’t absorb more (but can still be used to cast out stored energy)

items.name: Rod of Alertness
items.description: This rod grants heightened awareness. While holding it, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on initiative rolls. It also has magical spells: you can use an action to cast **Detect Evil and Good**, **Detect Magic**, **Detect Poison and Disease**, or **See Invisibility** without expending charges.
