Additionally, once per day, you can plant the rod in the ground (action) to activate an aura for 1 minute: you and allies in a 60-ft radius gain +1 bonus to AC and saving throws and can’t be surprised

items.name: Rod of Lordly Might
items.description: A mighty rod that can transform into various weapons. It has several buttons: one turns it into a flame-tongue sword, one into a +3 mace, one into a battleaxe, one extends it into a 50-foot climbing pole, one turns it into a battering ram, etc. It also can drain life: on a hit, you can force a target to make a DC 17 Constitution save or take an extra 4d6 necrotic and you heal that much. It has limited charges for some abilities (recharging daily). This rod is a powerful and versatile weapon and tool

items.name: Rod of Resurrection
items.description: This rod has 5 charges and regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn. If you are holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to cast **Cure Wounds** at 5th level, or expend 5 charges to cast **Resurrection**. The rod can bring someone back from the dead or heal with powerful magic, but if it ever uses the last charge, roll a d20; on a 1, the rod crumbles into dust

items.name: Rod of Rulership
items.description: While holding this rod, you can use an action to present it and command obedience. Each creature of your choice within 120 feet that can see you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or be charmed by you for 8 hours. While charmed, they regard you as their trusted leader. If you or your allies harm them, or give obviously suicidal orders, they can repeat the save to end the effect. This ability can be used once per dawn

items.name: Rod of Security
items.description: This rod can create a safe extraplanar haven. You can use an action to activate it, transporting yourself and up to 199 other willing creatures to a paradise demiplane where they experience true bliss, rest, and recuperation. The rod can maintain this paradise for a number of days equal to 200 divided by the number of creatures present (so more creatures means shorter duration). All creatures are fed, sheltered, and healed as if they had full rest. When time is up or you choose to end it, all return to the point of departure. The rod can’t be used again for 10 days

items.name: Rope of Climbing
items.description: A 60-foot length of silk rope that obeys commands. You can use a bonus action to command the rope to move or knot itself. It can move 10 feet on your turn when commanded. For example, you can command it to snake its way up a wall and fasten itself to something. It can hold up to 3,000 pounds and has AC 20 and 20 HP. If cut, it regenerates when mended together

items.name: Rope of Entanglement
items.description: This 30-foot long rope can be commanded to entangle a target. You can use an action to speak its command word and target a creature within 20 feet. The rope darts toward the target, which must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity save or be restrained. It can repeat the save each turn to try to escape. You can release the creature by ordering the rope to uncoil

items.name: Rope of Mending
items.description: A 50-foot hempen rope that can magically repair itself. If cut, you can hold the severed ends together and speak the command word. The rope instantly knits back together, good as new

items.name: Ruby of the War Mage
items.description: A small ruby that can be attached to a weapon. Once attached and attuned, it allows you to use that weapon as a spellcasting focus for your spells (if you could normally use an arcane focus). This allows, for example, a wizard or sorcerer to cast spells while wielding a sword with the ruby affixed

items.name: Saddle of the Cavalier
items.description: A well-crafted riding saddle. While seated in this saddle on a mount, you can’t be dismounted against your will (attackers can’t cause you to fall off your mount), and you have advantage on saving throws to avoid falling off. It provides exceptional security for mounted combat

items.name: Scarab of Protection
items.description: A beetle-shaped amulet that provides potent defense against evil. While attuned, you gain advantage on saves against spells. Additionally, the scarab has 12 charges. If you fail a saving throw against a necromancy spell or a spell from an undead creature, you can expend 1 charge as a reaction to turn the failed save into a successful save. The scarab crumbles when it has no charges left. Also, the scarab automatically alerts you if an undead is within 30 feet of you

items.name: Scimitar of Speed
items.description: A magic scimitar +2 that grants incredible swiftness. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage with it. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns

items.name: Scroll of Protection
items.description: A protective scroll tuned to a specific creature type (such as fiends, undead, elementals, etc.). Using an action, you read the scroll to create an invisible barrier around you for 5 minutes. The barrier prevents creatures of the specified type from entering or affecting anything within. The scroll then crumbles. Each scroll is effective against one type of creature (specified on the scroll)

items.name: Sending Stones
items.description: A pair of smooth stones with matching engravings. One stone is kept by you, the other by whomever you give it to. While you have one, you can use an action to cast **Sending** from it (targeting the bearer of the other stone). The spell is delivered without chance of failure (regardless of plane). Once **Sending** is used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn. Essentially, it’s a two-way long-distance communication device

items.name: Sentinel Shield
items.description: A emblazoned shield that heightens alertness. While holding this shield, you have advantage on initiative rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks. The shield’s face is often decorated with an eye motif, signifying vigilance

items.name: Shield of Expression
items.description: A shield with a humanoid face embossed on it. As a bonus action, you can change the facial expression shown on the shield (smiling, angry, sad, etc.). This has no mechanical effect but can be used for intimidation or amusement

items.name: Shield of Missile Attraction
items.description: A cursed +2 shield. While attuned, you have resistance to damage from ranged weapon attacks. However, all ranged weapon attacks target you over others: any ranged weapon attack that could hit a creature within 10 feet of you targets you instead. You cannot end the attunement to this shield voluntarily unless you are targeted by **Remove Curse**

items.name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
items.description: While wearing these lightweight shoes, you can stand on and walk along walls or ceilings as if you were on the ground. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the slippers don’t allow you to move this way on slippery surfaces (like ice or oil)

items.name: Smoldering Armor
items.description: A suit of armor that, while worn, constantly emits harmless, odorless wisps of smoke. It doesn’t provide any special protection or disadvantage; it just gives a dramatic, smoky effect to your appearance

items.name: Sovereign Glue
items.description: A viscous milky-white adhesive. One drop can cover a 1-foot square. It bonds almost any two objects together permanently. The glue takes 1 minute to set. Only a **Wish** spell or **Universal Solvent** can dissolve it once it sets. It’s incredibly strong; separating bonded items requires destroying one of them. Typically found in a jar with only a small quantity (d6+1 ounces)

items.name: Spell Scroll
items.description: A single-use scroll containing a spell. The spell’s level determines the scroll’s rarity (Common for cantrip or 1st level, Uncommon for 2nd–3rd, Rare 4th–5th, Very Rare 6th–8th, Legendary 9th). If the spell is on your class’s spell list, you can cast it from the scroll (using the scroll’s casting time) without providing components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. After casting, the scroll’s text fades. If the spell’s level is higher than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check to cast it (DC 10 + spell level) or the spell fails

items.name: Spellguard Shield
items.description: A shield that bears protective enchantments against magic. While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against you

items.name: Sphere of Annihilation
items.description: A 2-foot diameter black sphere that obliterates matter. It’s a hole in the multiverse that disintegrates everything it touches. Moving it requires a mental contest (Arcana check) and it can be very dangerous to control (if you lose control, it can move toward you). Anything that comes into contact with the sphere (that isn’t protected by powerful magic) is instantly destroyed, obliterated from existence. This is an artifact-level item and often guarded by powerful forces or traps:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

items.name: Staff of Adornment
items.description: A simple wooden staff with a decorative top. You can use an action to cause a Small object (up to 1 pound) to float an inch above the tip of the staff and remain there until you remove it or another object takes its place. You can have up to three objects orbiting the staff’s tip in this way. It’s mostly a cosmetic or convenience effect (for displaying trinkets or keeping a torch aloft, etc.)

items.name: Staff of Birdcalls
items.description: This wooden staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cause the staff to emit one of several common bird calls (like a finch’s chirp, a raven’s caw, a duck’s quack, etc.). It regains 1d6+4 charges each day at dawn. It’s primarily an amusement or tool for hunters to mimic bird sounds

items.name: Staff of Charming
items.description: This staff has 10 charges and can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff. While holding it, you can expend charges to cast the following spells (save DC 15): **Charm Person** (1 charge), **Command** (1 charge), or **Comprehend Languages** (1 charge). The staff regains 1d8+2 charges at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, it loses its magic. Attacks with the staff use your spell attack bonus for hit and damage

items.name: Staff of Fire
items.description: This staff can be used as a +2 quarterstaff and has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend charges to cast the following spells (save DC 15): **Burning Hands** (1 charge), **Fireball** (3 charges), **Wall of Fire** (4 charges). It regains 1d6+4 charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the staff blackens and crumbles to ashes

items.name: Staff of Flowers
items.description: This wooden staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cause a flower to sprout from a patch of earth or soil within 5 feet. The flower is mundane (nonmagical) and can be of any type you choose (sunflower, rose, lily, etc.), though it withers normally. The staff regains 1d6+4 charges each day at dawn

items.name: Staff of Frost
items.description: This staff can be used as a +2 quarterstaff and has 10 charges. It requires attunement by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard. While holding it, you can expend charges (spell save DC 15) to cast: **Cone of Cold** (5 charges), **Fog Cloud** (1 charge), **Ice Storm** (4 charges), or **Wall of Ice** (4 charges). It also grants resistance to cold damage while attuned. The staff regains 1d6+4 charges each dawn. If the last charge is expended, roll d20; on a 1, the staff turns to ice and melts away

items.name: Staff of Healing
items.description: This staff has 10 charges. It can be attuned by a bard, cleric, or druid. While holding it, you can use an action to expend charges to cast one of the following spells using your spellcasting ability: **Cure Wounds** (1 charge per spell level, up to 4th), **Lesser Restoration** (2 charges), or **Mass Cure Wounds** (5 charges). The staff regains 1d6+4 charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the staff withers into dust

items.name: Staff of Power
items.description: This staff functions as a +2 quarterstaff. It has 20 charges and can be attuned by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard. While holding it, you gain +2 to spell attack rolls. You can use an action to expend charges to cast spells (save DC 17) such as **Lightning Bolt** (3 charges), **Fireball** (5 charges), **Cone of Cold** (5 charges), **Hold Monster** (5 charges), **Wall of Force** (5 charges). It also grants other benefits: advantage on saving throws vs spells, etc. If you drop to 0 HP while holding it, you can choose to break the staff, performing a Retributive Strike that deals massive damage in an area (destroying the staff). The staff regains 2d8+4 charges daily. If the last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the staff loses its magic (but doesn’t explode)

items.name: Staff of Striking
items.description: This is a magic quarterstaff +3. It has 10 charges. When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend up to 3 charges to deal an extra 1d6 force damage per charge expended. The staff regains 1d6+4 expended charges each day at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the staff loses its magic bonus (becoming a nonmagical quarterstaff)

items.name: Staff of Swarming Insects
items.description: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend some charges to cast one of the following (spell save DC 15): **Giant Insect** (4 charges) or **Insect Plague** (5 charges). You can also expend 1 charge to create a swarm of harmless flying insects around you (providing lightly obscuring cover) for 10 minutes. The staff regains 1d6+4 charges each dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the staff crumbles into a swarm of insects and is destroyed

items.name: Staff of the Adder
items.description: This serpent-headed staff can transform its head into a venomous snake. You can use a bonus action to speak a command word and turn the staff’s head into a live snake’s head for 1 minute. You can then use the staff to make melee attacks (using your proficiency) that deal 1d6 piercing plus 3d6 poison damage. The snake head can be attacked (AC 15, 20 HP). If it drops to 0 HP, the head is destroyed and reverts, and the staff loses this power. You can’t use the transformation again until the next dawn if the snake is killed

items.name: Staff of the Magi
items.description: A legendary staff for sorcerers, warlocks, or wizards, combining immense magical power. It functions as a +2 quarterstaff. It has 50 charges and holds almost every wizard spell (from **Fireball** to **Lightning Bolt**, **Passwall**, **Telekinesis**, etc.), allowing you to cast them by expending charges instead of spell slots (using your save DC). It regains 4d6+2 charges daily. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 20, it regains 1 charge. On any other result, it loses magic and, if broken deliberately as a last resort, causes a devastating Retributive Strike (like a mini-explosion of magical energy). The staff also provides absorption of spells like a Rod of Absorption. A staff of this caliber is an artifact-level item

items.name: Staff of the Python
items.description: You can use an action to speak this staff’s command word and throw it on the ground. It transforms into a Giant Constrictor Snake under your control. The snake acts on its own initiative but obeys your verbal commands. The snake exists for up to 1 hour or until it drops to 0 HP, at which point it reverts to staff form. It reverts early if you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or if you die. When the snake reverts, it returns to staff form (and any remaining damage it had carries over to the staff). If the staff is destroyed, it is lost forever

items.name: Staff of the Woodlands
items.description: This oak staff can be wielded as a +2 quarterstaff. It can be attuned by a druid and has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend charges (spell save DC 15) to cast spells: **Animal Friendship** (1 charge), **Awaken** (5 charges), **Barkskin** (2 charges), **Locate Animals or Plants** (2 charges), **Speak with Animals** (1 charge), **Speak with Plants** (3 charges), or **Wall of Thorns** (6 charges). The staff regains 1d6+4 charges at dawn. Additionally, you can use an action to plant the staff in fertile earth and expend 1 charge to instantly transform it into a healthy tree (60-foot tall oak). The tree lasts for 1 day or until felled, after which the staff reappears in your hands

items.name: Staff of Thunder and Lightning
items.description: This staff can be used as a +2 quarterstaff. It has 5 distinct magical effects, each usable once per dawn: **Thunderclap** (upon hitting a target, you can create a thunder boom: extra 2d6 thunder damage and deafen target, Con DC 17), **Lightning** (cast a 5d6 lightning bolt from the staff, 120 ft line, Dex DC 17 half), **Thunder and Lightning** (combine the above two effects on a hit), **Lightning Strike** (cast a lightning bolt as an action, 120 ft line, 9d6 damage, Dex DC 17 half), **Thunder Strike** (cause thunder on hit: 2d6 thunder damage and push target 10 ft, Con DC 17 or be stunned). Each effect uses a charge; total limited uses. Once all are used, it functions simply as a +2 staff until recharged at dawn

items.name: Staff of Withering
items.description: This staff functions as a +1 quarterstaff. It has 3 charges. When you hit with a melee attack, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d10 necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or have disadvantage on Strength and Constitution checks for 1 hour (as their body withers). The staff regains 1d3 charges each dawn

items.name: Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals
items.description: If the stone is on the ground, you can use an action to speak its command word and summon an earth elemental, as if you had cast **Conjure Elemental**. The elemental is friendly and obeys your commands. It remains for up to 1 hour or until destroyed. The stone can’t be used this way again until the next dawn

items.name: Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone)
items.description: While this polished agate stone is on your person, you gain a +1 bonus to ability checks and saving throws. It’s a subtle but persistent boon to all your endeavors

items.name: Sun Blade
items.description: This item appears to be a hilt with no blade. When grasped, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring forth, functioning as a longsword. You have proficiency with it even if not normally proficient. It deals radiant damage instead of slashing (1d8, or 1d10 versatile) and has the finesse property. It gives +2 bonus to attack and damage, and when you hit undead, it deals an extra 1d8 radiant. The blade emits bright sunlight in a 15-ft radius (and dim light 15 ft further). You can use an action to adjust the radius of light up or down

items.name: Sword of Answering
items.description: One of a set of legendary sentient longswords (each named). It is a +3 longsword with special reactive ability: if an enemy attacks you, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack back at them with advantage (you can’t use this if surprised). It also ignores resistance or immunity to slashing damage. Each Sword of Answering has a unique personality and alignment, often encouraging the wielder to act in accordance with its ethos

items.name: Sword of Kas
items.description: A wicked +3 longsword once wielded by Kas, the lieutenant of Vecna. It deals extra necrotic damage on a hit, grants the wielder a bonus to AC, saving throws, and immunity to charm. It possesses sentience and an evil ego. It can cast **Haste** on the wielder and demands blood. The sword also has a thirst for destroying Vecna and his creations. It is an artifact with many story-driven powers and potentially drawbacks (curses), known for betraying its master eventually. It shines with dark purpose and whispers to its user

items.name: Sword of Life Stealing
items.description: A +1 magic sword that thirsts for life energy. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, it deals an extra 10 necrotic damage, and you gain 10 temporary hit points

items.name: Sword of Sharpness
items.description: A magic sword (usually longsword or greatsword) that slices through armor. On a 20 attack roll, it deals max damage plus an extra 14 slashing damage. Also, when you roll a 20, you lop off a limb of your choice from the target (if it has any and the DM deems it appropriate). When you attack an object with it, you deal double damage

items.name: Sword of Vengeance
items.description: A +1 cursed sword that demands blood. Attuning curses you with berserker rage: if you are damaged in combat, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or attack the nearest creature (even an ally) on your next turn. The sword also cannot be parted from willingly while cursed. Only a **Remove Curse** can break the attunement. Despite the curse, it is a +1 weapon

items.name: Sword of Wounding
items.description: A magic sword +1 that causes persistent wounds. A creature hit by this sword can’t regain hit points until the start of your next turn. In addition, whenever you hit a creature, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of its turns for each time you’ve hit it (stacking wounds). The creature can make a DC 15 Constitution save at the end of its turn to stop all ongoing wound damage

items.name: Talisman of Pure Good
items.description: A mighty holy amulet that can only be attuned by a creature of **good** alignment (cleric or paladin). While you wear it, any fiend or undead that attacks you has disadvantage. Additionally, if you are a cleric or paladin, you can use an action to invoke the talisman and smite an evil-aligned extraplanar creature: the target (within 30 ft) must make a DC 20 Charisma save or be consumed by holy fire (if 100 HP or fewer, it is instantly destroyed; if more, it takes 6d6 radiant). Once used, this property can’t be used until the next dawn. If a nongood creature touches the talisman, it takes 6d6 radiant damage

items.name: Talisman of the Sphere
items.description: An amulet that aids in controlling a **Sphere of Annihilation**. If you are attuned and within 60 ft of a Sphere of Annihilation, you can use an action to control it better: you gain a +2 bonus to the Intelligence (Arcana) checks to move it, and if you tie for control with another creature, you win. Additionally, if you fail by 10 or more when moving the sphere with this talisman, it doesn’t automatically move toward you (so it mitigates some risk). Essentially, it grants mastery over that destructive artifact. However, the talisman offers no benefit if a Sphere isn’t present

items.name: Talisman of Ultimate Evil
items.description: The counterpart to the Talisman of Pure Good, this amulet can only be attuned by an **evil** cleric or paladin (or similar). Fiends and undead friendly to you gain advantage on attacks against others nearby. If you are evil-aligned and attuned, you can use an action to touch the talisman to the ground, creating a fissure under the feet of a good-aligned creature you see within 120 feet. The target must make a DC 20 Dexterity save or fall into the fissure, which then closes – trapping the creature in a demiplane of torment forever (if they die there, their soul is damned). This power is usable once per dawn. If a nonevil creature touches the talisman, they take 8d6 necrotic damage

items.name: Talking Doll
items.description: A small child’s doll crafted with minor enchantment. While attuned, you can teach the doll up to six phrases, each up to 6 words. You can also set conditions for the doll to say each phrase. For example, you can have it say “I love you” when someone picks it up, or utter a creepy giggle when it’s nighttime. The doll’s phrases can be changed whenever you spend 1 minute to teach it new words

items.name: Tankard of Sobriety
items.description: This pewter tankard has a lid that seals tight. Any alcoholic beverage poured into it loses all alcoholic content. No matter how much you drink from this tankard, you will never become intoxicated. It’s a favorite of those who want to partake in social drinking without the negative effects

items.name: Tentacle Rod
items.description: A rod topped with three rubbery tentacles. While holding it, you can use an action to direct each tentacle to strike a creature within 15 feet. The rod makes three melee attacks (using your spell attack modifier). If one or more tentacles hit, the target must make a DC 15 Constitution save or have its speed halved and suffer disadvantage on Dexterity saves for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns to end the effect. The rod’s attacks deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage each

items.name: Tome of Clear Thought
items.description: Another magical tome. Studying this book for 48 hours (over no more than 6 days) increases your Intelligence score by 2, and your maximum for that score by 2. The tome then loses its magic for 100 years

items.name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
items.description: A tome that can refine one’s force of personality. If you spend 48 hours over ≤6 days studying it, your Charisma score increases by 2, and your maximum for that score increases by 2. The tome then becomes blank for a century

items.name: Tome of the Stilled Tongue
items.description: A sinister spellbook said to be made from the tongue of a treacherous spellcaster. While attuned (must be a wizard), you can use an action to cast any spell inscribed in this tome without speaking its verbal component and without expending a spell slot, once per day. However, each time you do so, there is a cumulative chance that the tome exacts a price (like temporarily preventing you from speaking or other curses). This tome often contains many spells and serves as a spellbook as well. It is a dangerous but coveted item for wizards

items.name: Tome of Understanding
items.description: Yet another magical tome. Studying it for 48 hours (within 6 days) increases your Wisdom score by 2, and your maximum for Wisdom by 2. The tome then loses its magic for 100 years

items.name: Trident of Fish Command
items.description: A magic trident that grants the ability to control fish. It has 3 charges. While attuned, you can expend 1 charge to cast **Dominate Beast** (save DC 15) but only on beasts that have an innate swimming speed (i.e., aquatic creatures). The trident regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn

items.name: Unbreakable Arrow
items.description: This arrow is magically reinforced. It cannot be broken, except when inside an antimagic field (in which case it becomes mundane and could be snapped). Otherwise, it always remains intact, allowing for reuse

items.name: Universal Solvent
items.description: A thick, clear liquid in a jar. When applied to any substance (an object, adhesive, etc.), it immediately dissolves it. For instance, one dose of universal solvent will instantly and safely dissolve Sovereign Glue or any adhesive, as well as other organic or inorganic materials. It’s extremely rare and valuable for removing curses or sticky predicaments

items.name: Veteran's Cane
items.description: An ornate walking cane that conceals a hidden blade. You can speak a command word to transform it into a +1 longsword. The first time you hit with the sword, it deals an extra 1d4 damage (this is the cane’s only magical effect). After one use, the cane’s magic fades to just being a normal cane with a sword inside

items.name: Vicious Weapon
items.description: A magic weapon that punishes foes on critical hits. When you roll a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon, it deals an additional 7 damage of the weapon’s type to the target. (There is no bonus on non-critical hits)

items.name: Vorpal Sword
items.description: A +3 enchanted sword of unparalleled sharpness. On a roll of 20 (critical hit) against a creature that has a head, the sword cuts off that head, instantly killing the creature. A creature immune to slashing damage or too large for decapitation (GM’s call) instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage. The sword cannot sever heads of certain creatures (like many undead, golems, etc. that lack vulnerable necks). Otherwise, this is one of the deadliest blades in existence

items.name: Walloping Ammunition
items.description: A piece of magic ammunition (arrow, bolt, etc.) that packs extra punch. If this ammo hits a target, the target must succeed on a DC 10 Strength save or be knocked **prone**. After striking, the ammo is no longer magical (and likely destroyed or lost as normal)

items.name: Wand of Binding
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend charges to cast **Hold Monster** (5 charges, save DC 17) or **Hold Person** (2 charges, save DC 17). Additionally, you can use a reaction when you would be grappled or restrained to expend 1 charge and gain advantage on any saving throw or check to avoid being restrained. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the wand crumbles into dust

items.name: Wand of Conducting
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to create orchestral music that only you (and creatures you choose within 30 ft) can hear. The music plays for 1 minute. Essentially, it allows you to conduct an invisible orchestra for dramatic effect. The wand regains all charges at dawn

items.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and make it pulse with warning. For the next minute, the wand points toward the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet (if any are present). The wand can sense shapechangers or creatures disguised by magic. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges each dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, it becomes a nonmagical stick

items.name: Wand of Fear
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 2 charges to cast **Fear** (save DC 15). Alternatively, you can expend 1 charge and command one creature to flee (functioning like the command “Flee” from the **Command** spell, DC 15). The wand regains 1d6+1 charges daily at dawn. If the last charge is expended, roll d20; on a 1, the wand crumbles into ash

items.name: Wand of Fireballs
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast the **Fireball** spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, it’s a 3rd-level Fireball (8d6 fire). You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge expended. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges each dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the wand erupts in flames and is destroyed

items.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast **Lightning Bolt** (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, it’s cast at 3rd level (8d6 lightning). Each additional charge increases the spell’s level by one. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the wand splits with a crack of thunder and is destroyed

items.name: Wand of Magic Detection
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast **Detect Magic**. The wand regains 1d3 charges daily. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, it disintegrates into fine dust

items.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast the **Magic Missile** spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast it at 1st level (3 darts). You can increase the spell slot by one for each additional charge expended. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges daily. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, it crumbles into powder

items.name: Wand of Orcus
items.description: A dread artifact: the skull-topped wand wielded by the demon lord Orcus. It’s imbued with immense necromantic power and unspeakable evil:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}. It functions as a +3 mace that deals extra necrotic damage. While attuned, you can cast *Power Word Kill*, *Finger of Death*, *Circle of Death*, and many other death-related spells from it. Any undead around you gain additional resilience. However, the wand also has a curse of soul-devouring: any humanoid killed by it rises as a zombie under Orcus’s control. The wand is sentient and seeks to spread death. It can also summon undead and has many other horrific abilities. Only by divine intervention can it be destroyed. (Note: This is one of the most dangerous evil artifacts in D&D)

items.name: Wand of Paralysis
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and fire a paralyzing ray at a creature within 60 feet. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at end of each turn. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges each day. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the wand becomes a nonmagical stick

items.name: Wand of Polymorph
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to cast **Polymorph** (save DC 15). The wand regains 1d6+1 charges daily at dawn. If the last charge is expended, roll d20; on a 1, it transforms into a random tiny creature and scampers away, forever lost (i.e., destroyed in a whimsical fashion)

items.name: Wand of Pyrotechnics
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to create a harmless burst of multicolored light at a point you can see up to 60 feet away. The burst is like a small firework: it emits bright light (20 ft) and dim light (another 20 ft) and a crackling sound. The lights linger for a second. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, it pops into a cloud of sparkling smoke and is gone

items.name: Wand of Scowls
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to target a humanoid you can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma save or its face is forced into a scowl for 1 minute. The effect is purely cosmetic and doesn’t harm the target (though it might affect social interactions). The wand regains all charges daily at dawn

items.name: Wand of Secrets
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge. If there is a secret door or trap within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains 1d3 charges at dawn

items.name: Wand of Smiles
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. You can use an action to expend 1 charge, targeting a humanoid within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma save or be forced to smile for 1 minute. The effect is harmless (just a goofy grin). The wand regains all charges at dawn. If the last charge is used, roll d20; on a 1, the wand transforms into a small hand mirror that makes whoever looks in it smile

items.name: Wand of Web
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to cast **Web** (save DC 15). The wand regains 1d6+1 charges at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll d20; on a 1, the wand dissolves into sticky spiderwebs

items.name: Wand of Wonder
items.description: A chaotic wand with 7 charges. When you use an action to expend 1 charge, it produces a random magical effect. Possible effects include: stream of butterflies, a burst of flowers, **Lightning Bolt**, **Slow**, **Enlarge** self, **Grass** grows, **Gust of Wind**, gems spray, etc., determined by a d100 roll on a provided table:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}. The results can be beneficial or odd. The wand regains 1d6+1 charges at dawn. If the last charge is expended, roll d20; on a 1, it crumbles into dust

items.name: Weapon of Warning
items.description: Any weapon (usually a sword) with a minor enchantment that vibrates to warn of danger. While attuned and the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, you and your allies within 30 feet cannot be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions when combat begins (if you were sleeping naturally)

items.name: Well of Many Worlds
items.description: A silk handkerchief that unfolds into a 6-foot diameter circular cloth. When spread on the ground, it creates a two-way portal to another world or plane of existence. Each time it is activated (unfurled), it connects to a random plane (or location determined by the GM). Creatures or objects that go through disappear into that plane. The well is a one-of-a-kind and unpredictable item; it closes when picked up (or if half is folded onto the other). It can be used for escape or banishment, but one never knows what alien realm it will lead to next

items.name: Whelm
items.description: Whelm is a sentient +3 warhammer once wielded by a dwarven hero. It has the thrown property (range 20/60) and returns to the wielder’s hand. It deals an extra 1d8 thunder damage to giants. Once per day, it can be struck against the ground to create a shock wave (as **Thunderwave**, DC 15). It can also detect the presence of evil creatures or precious metals. However, Whelm has a strong personality: it seeks to slay goblins and giants above all, and it demands that its wielder carry no other weapons. Its attunement can conflict if the user doesn’t align with its goals (like leaving a fight with giants). It also causes its wielder to become obsessed with treasure. Overall, it’s a powerful but willful artifact

items.name: Wind Fan
items.description: A folding hand-fan painted with images of gusting clouds. While holding it, you can use an action to cast **Gust of Wind** (DC 13). The fan can be used this way up to 3 times per day. Each use beyond the first has a cumulative 20% chance of tearing the fan, rendering it nonmagical and unusable. If not overused, it regains all uses at dawn

items.name: Winged Boots
items.description: A pair of boots with small wings at the ankles. While wearing them, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can fly up to 4 hours total (all at once or in shorter flights of at least 1 minute). If you exceed 4 hours, the boots cease to function until they have rested (1 hour of rest per 2 hours of flying). They regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren’t in use. If you are airborne when the duration expires, you float gently to the ground

items.name: Wings of Flying
items.description: A cape or cloak that, on command, transforms into a pair of bat or bird-like wings. While the wings are present, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet. The wings last for up to 1 hour per use, and the effect can be used once before requiring a rest (it resets at dawn). When the wings vanish (or if you dismiss them as a bonus action), the cloak returns to normal. If you’re flying when the duration ends, you descend slowly for 1 minute (as with Feather Fall) before the magic dissipates

items.name: Amulet of the Devout, +X
items.attunement: Requires attunement by a cleric or paladin

items.name: Moon Sickle, +X
items.attunement: Requires attunement by a druid or ranger

items.name: Rhythm-Maker's Drum
items.description: A finely-crafted drum granting a bonus (+1 to +3) to spell attack rolls and save DCs for bards. If attuned, you regain one use of Bardic Inspiration after a long rest.

items.name: Guardian Emblem
items.description: A holy symbol that can be affixed to a shield. It has 3 charges. When you or an ally within 30 ft suffers a critical hit, you can use your reaction to expend a charge to turn that critical hit into a normal hit. The emblem regains all charges at dawn.

items.name: Devotee's Censer
items.description: A flail that doubles as a thurible (incense burner). It deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage on a hit. While attuned, as an action once per day you can cause fragrant healing smoke to billow out: all allies within 10 ft heal 1d4 + 1 hit points.

items.name: Baba Yaga's Mortar and Pestle
items.description: This artifact consists of a large mortar (bowl) and pestle. It can expand in size to carry you and up to 3 others, flying through the air at high speed. It can plane shift to other realms associated with Baba Yaga. It can also grind materials (like creatures or magical herbs) to produce potions or effects. The Mortar and Pestle are sentient and extremely powerful, often with unique effects and a degree of unpredictability, tied intimately to the legendary witch Baba Yaga.

items.name: Absorbing Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo that grants resistance to a specific damage type (chosen when applied). When you take damage of that type, you can use your reaction to gain immunity to that instance of damage and regain hit points equal to half the damage absorbed (once per dawn).

items.name: Barrier Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo that manifests as protective patterns on your skin. While you aren’t wearing armor, it gives you an AC based on its rarity: Uncommon (AC 12 + Dex mod), Rare (AC 15 + Dex mod, max +2), Very Rare (AC 18).

items.name: Blood Fury Tattoo
items.description: A red ink tattoo representing fury in battle (10 charges). When you hit a creature, you can expend a charge to deal an extra 4d6 necrotic and gain that much HP (as healing). When you take damage, you can use a reaction and expend a charge to make a melee attack with advantage against the attacker on your next turn. The tattoo regains all charges at dawn.

items.name: Coiling Grasp Tattoo
items.description: An ink tattoo of spiraling vines or tentacles. As an action, you can force a creature within 15 ft to make a DC 14 Strength save or take 3d6 piercing damage and be grappled (escape DC 14). The effect ends if you stop it or the creature escapes.

items.name: Eldritch Claw Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo of claw-like marks. Your unarmed strikes count as magical and get +1 to hit and damage. As a bonus action once per day, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute: your melee attacks gain a 15-foot reach as spectral claws lash out, and they deal +1d6 force damage on a hit.

items.name: Ghost Step Tattoo
items.description: An ethereal-themed tattoo (3 charges). As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to become incorporeal until the end of your turn. While ghostly, you have resistance to all damage except force, and you can move through creatures and objects (taking 1d10 force if you end inside one). Regains all charges at dawn.

items.name: Illuminator's Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo of ink and calligraphy. You can touch a piece of writing up to one page and cause it to become invisible to everyone except you and those you designate for 24 hours. Also, as an action, you can cause your fingertip to act as an ink pen that writes in any color ink (or magically writes on a surface) for you, even while you aren’t touching a surface.

items.name: Lifewell Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo showing symbols of life and warding off death. If you would drop to 0 HP, you instead drop to 1 HP and the tattoo deactivates this effect until the next dawn. Also, you have advantage on death saving throws while tattooed.

items.name: Masquerade Tattoo
items.description: A shifting, colorful tattoo. You can use an action to change the tattoo’s appearance and location on your body. Additionally, you can cast **Disguise Self** from it once per day (DC 13) to change your overall appearance for 1 hour.

items.name: Shadowfell Brand Tattoo
items.description: A dark, smoky tattoo. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to become shadowy and insubstantial until the start of your next turn. In that state, you have resistance to all damage. Once used, this property can’t be used again until you finish a short or long rest. Also, you gain darkvision 60 ft if you don’t have it, and advantage on Stealth checks at night.

items.name: Spellwrought Tattoo
items.description: A tattoo imbued with a single spell (determined at creation). It acts like a one-use scroll on your skin. You can cast the spell once from the tattoo, without needing components. The spell’s level determines the tattoo’s rarity (1st level Common, 2nd Uncommon, 3rd Rare, 4th Very Rare, 5th or higher Legendary). After you cast the spell, the tattoo’s magic fades away.

items.name: Dragonhide Belt
items.description: A belt made of dragon hide, favored by monks. It grants a bonus (+1 to +3 depending on rarity) to the saving throw DC of your Ki features (like Stunning Strike). Additionally, when you use Step of the Wind, you can recover a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus (once per day).

items.name: Dragonlance
items.description: A fabled lance infused with draconic power. It is a +3 lance that deals an extra 3d6 radiant damage to dragons. Allied creatures within 30 ft of you gain advantage on saving throws against a dragon’s Frightful Presence. In the hands of a dragon-rider or hero of destiny, it can turn the tide of a battle with a dragon.

items.name: Dragon's Wrath Weapon
items.description: A weapon infused with the essence of a dragon’s wrath. It’s a +1 to +3 weapon depending on rarity. It deals extra damage of the dragon’s type (e.g., +1d6 fire for red dragon) on a hit. On a critical hit, the target and creatures around it take additional damage of that type (as a small burst of draconic energy).

items.name: Gold Canary Figurine of Wondrous Power
items.description: This magical figurine can become a Giant Canary which then transforms into a Gold Dragon Wyrmling for up to 1 hour. The dragon wyrmling is friendly to you and can fight on your behalf. After it reverts to figurine form, it can’t be used again until 7 days have passed.

items.name: Topaz Annihilator
items.description: A rare experimental firearm crafted with topaz dragon shards. This magical ranged weapon fires a line of crackling energy. It deals 2d12 piercing + 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit. If it reduces an undead to 0 HP, that undead is disintegrated. It ignores the loading property (no reload time). Ammunition is a special crystal charge. It’s a powerful yet unstable weapon from an advanced society.

items.name: Technically "Plate" Armor
items.description: A gag armor set made by strapping actual metal plates (from a kitchen) onto oneself. It provides AC similar to plate armor (AC 18) but is extremely brittle. If you take a critical hit while wearing this, the armor’s AC is reduced by 1 as plates shatter. It’s an impractical, humorous creation born of desperation.

items.name: Dryad's Gift
items.description: A +2 longbow crafted from a living tree branch by a grateful dryad. It requires no arrows — when drawn, it magically forms an arrow from nearby plant material. While attuned, you have advantage on Stealth checks in forests and can communicate simple ideas to plants. Once per day, you can touch a tree and send a short message through the forest that is delivered by rustling leaves to a creature you designate in the same forest.

items.name: Fine Mustache
items.description: A dapper fake mustache. When applied, it magically adheres. While wearing it, your Charisma increases by 1 (to a max of 20) for purposes of polite social interactions, and you have advantage on Persuasion checks to appear distinguished. However, if someone attempts to forcibly remove the mustache, it lets out a squeaky protest.

items.name: Relentless Stinger
items.description: A rapier with a wasp-themed hilt. It’s a +1 weapon. When you score a killing blow on a creature with this rapier, you gain a +2 bonus to damage on your next attack with it (within 1 minute). This effect stacks if you quickly finish off multiple foes, but resets if a minute passes with no kills.

items.name: Blade of the Unbroken Circle
items.description: A longsword +2 grown from an ancient treant’s branch. Druids can wield it as a focus. It grants +2 to attack/damage. If you’re an elf or druid, it’s especially potent: you can use Wisdom instead of Strength to attack. It has 10 charges and regains 1d6+4 at dawn (full for druids). You can expend charges to cast spells (DC 17): 2 for **Barkskin**, 3 for **Plant Growth**, 5 for **Tree Stride**, 6 for **Wall of Thorns**, 7 for **Regenerate**. On a hit, you can expend 1 charge to deal +2d6 bonus damage of a type reflecting the terrain (e.g., in forest, slashing from brambles; in swamp, poison).

items.name: Arkanobow
items.description: A high-tech longbow hilt with no bow arms. As a bonus action, you can speak a command to make pure energy limbs appear, turning it into a functional longbow of crackling energy. It’s a +2 weapon. If you draw it without an arrow, it creates a lightning bolt arrow that deals lightning damage on hit instead of piercing. Against metal-armored targets, you have advantage on the attack. The bow’s energy source lasts 60 minutes total. You can recharge it by feeding spell slots into it (1 slot level = +1 minute). While attuned, you can spend extra energy (minutes of charge) to perform stunts like firing an explosive arrow (cost 5 minutes) or making a “jump shot” teleport to where your arrow lands (cost 10 minutes). If it runs out of power mid-flight, the limbs vanish but you safely glide to the ground.

items.name: Blazeblood Signet
items.description: A dark metal ring set with a blood-red gem that feels warm. While wearing it, you have resistance to cold damage and you regain all spent Hit Dice on a long rest. When you spend Hit Dice during a short rest, you regain maximum value. Additionally, when you hit a creature, you can choose to spend up to 5 of your Hit Dice. You gain temporary HP equal to half the total rolled (rounded up), and that creature takes an equal amount of fire damage. However, the ring is cursed: any magical healing you receive is halved in its effect.

items.name: Holy Symbol of Ravenkind
items.description: Platinum sunburst holy symbol holding 10 charges. Can emit sunlight, hinder or paralyze vampires, and empower Turn Undead (recharges daily).

items.name: Sunsword
items.description: Sentient sun blade (shortsword). Deals radiant damage, extra vs. undead, sheds bright sunlight on command.

items.name: Icon of Ravenloft
items.description: Ancient silver icon. Bolsters healing magic, harms fiends/undead with holy radiance once per dawn.

items.name: Bottle of Boundless Coffee
items.description: Self-refilling coffee flask that pours hot coffee all day (limited flow).

items.name: Dragon Vessel
items.description: Stoppered drinkware with draconic motifs. Once per day, transforms up to a pint of liquid into a chosen beverage or clean water; can warm/cool contents.

items.name: Cabal's Ruin
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Cloak that absorbs some spell energy and can release it as lightning; grows in power when Awakened/Exalted.

items.name: Deathwalker's Ward
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Raven-themed armor; grants defensive boons and bolsters death saves; stronger forms add necrotic resist and flight.

items.name: Fenthras
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Legendary longbow; +1 with minor extra lightning damage; higher states add greater power.

items.name: Spire of Conflux
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Blue crystal staff; +1 and minor spellcasting aid; later gains charges to cast stronger spells.

items.name: Titanstone Knuckles
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Massive gauntlets; grant ogre-like strength and boosted unarmed strikes; improve greatly as they awaken.

items.name: Whisper
items.description: (Vestige, Dormant) Dark dagger; +1 with necrotic bite; higher forms gain recall/teleport and stealthy slaying.

items.name: Boots of the Vigilant
items.description: Sense danger; after rolling initiative, add +1d8 once per day; wearing them helps you avoid being surprised.

items.name: Stormrider Boots
items.description: Once per short rest, burst of flight for a round; passing foes take minor lightning damage; OAs vs you have disadvantage.

items.name: Raven's Slumber
items.description: Crystal that can store a willing creature in safe stasis or (on hit, save negates) trap an unwilling creature; one creature at a time.

items.name: Cataclysm Bolts
items.description: Set of 10 crossbow bolts; each triggers a random elemental blast on hit; the bolt is destroyed after impact.

items.name: Earthboard
items.description: Stone 'board' for earth-gliding; grants burrow-like movement and lets you perform a shockwave landing once per short rest.

items.name: Skysail
items.description: Wearable glider; you can safely glide; 3 charges to cast fly on yourself for 1 minute; regains charges at dawn.

items.name: Dagger of Many Daggers
items.description: +1 dagger with 1/day ability to cast Cloud of Daggers (modest DC); visual effect of splitting into spectral blades.

items.name: Bag of Wondrous Randomization
items.description: Once per day, place an object inside to trigger a random magical effect from a wild d100 table; unpredictable outcomes.

items.name: Flask of Perpetual Booze
items.description: Ever-filling liquor flask; can pour ale, wine, or spirits of average quality indefinitely.

items.name: Brooch des Fleurs
items.description: Floral brooch with five magical petals; expend a petal for a themed effect (charm, heal, illusion, etc.); regrows one petal at dawn.
